{"code":1,"isDone":false,"toInsertArticleList":[{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","title":"How to screenshot on the Snapchat app without someone getting a notification of it","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-screenshot-on-snapchat-without-someone-knowing","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f2d9e0b243817795b5a27af?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Woman looking at apps on smartphone\" height=\"1852\" width=\"2469\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Snapchat automatically notifies a user when you&#39;ve taken a screenshot of their content, unless you use this workaround.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tim Robberts/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>To screenshot on Snapchat without someone knowing, you'll need to know how to set your phone in Airplane Mode and clear the app's cache.&#160;</li><li>You can clear the Snapchat cache through the Settings menu underneath Account Actions.&#160;</li><li>Snapchat typically notifies someone when you've screenshotted their messages or stories in the app, but Airplane Mode can prevent that from happening.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\">Visit Business Insider's Tech Reference library for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>As they say, everything you post on the internet is there forever. On Snapchat, an answer to that adage is built into the platform. The app's original promise was that anything you sent would disappear almost immediately after you sent it, lost to the internet aether.&#160;</p><p>With the added option for snaps not to have a timer and for conversations not to disappear, there's less of an atmosphere of secrecy on the app. That includes when you take screenshots. When you get a screenshot of a message or snap, it's standard policy for Snapchat to notify the person whose material you've captured immediately through the social platform.&#160;</p><p>While this helps protect user privacy, sometimes you may not want to notify a user of your screenshos. You might want to show someone who's not on the app something from a friend's story or even turn that perfect gif or meme response into your phone background.&#160;</p><p>In these cases, there's a way to take screenshots in Snapchat without notifying the person you're screenshotting. It will involve Airplane mode and clearing your app cache. Once you do the latter, Snapchat won't remember that you took the screenshot. Therefore, it won't be able to update the other user's profile to reflect that you took one.&#160;</p><p>Here's how to do it.&#160;</p><h2>How to take a screenshot on Snapchat without someone knowing</h2><p><strong>1.</strong> Before you open the snap, put your phone in Airplane Mode via Settings.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f2d97ec2618b92db65e0ec4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to screenshot on Snapchat without them knowing 1\" height=\"1334\" width=\"750\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Put your phone in Airplane Mode.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Melanie Weir/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>2.</strong> Open the snap and take your screenshot.</p><p><strong>3.</strong> Before taking your phone out of Airplane Mode, tap your profile icon in the top left corner of the screen.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f2d992e4dca680a7c1a552a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to screenshot on Snapchat without them knowing 2\" height=\"1334\" width=\"750\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tap your profile icon in the upper left of the screen.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Melanie Weir/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>4.</strong> In the top right corner of your profile menu, tap the Settings icon.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f2d994928ea7105232c8b46?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to screenshot on Snapchat without them knowing 3\" height=\"1334\" width=\"750\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Settings icon appears like a gear.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tap your profile icon in the upper left of the screen.</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>5.</strong> Scroll to the bottom of the Settings menu. Under Account Actions, tap Clear Cache.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f2d99714dca680ab16bd787?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to screenshot on Snapchat without them knowing 4\" height=\"1334\" width=\"750\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Scroll down and tap Clear Cache.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Melanie Weir/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>6.</strong> In the Clear Cache menu, tap Clear All.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f2d998e40c1f375c1259aeb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to screenshot on Snapchat without them knowing 5\" height=\"1334\" width=\"750\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>You want to clear your entire Snapchat cache.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Melanie Weir/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>7.</strong> A pop-up will appear asking you to confirm the action — tap Clear to confirm.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f2d99ac3ad8610cb81c8335?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to screenshot on Snapchat without them knowing 6\" height=\"1334\" width=\"750\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The message will also warn you that Snapchat will restart if you proceed.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Melanie Weir/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>8.</strong> Turn Airplane Mode off.&#160;</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5d8e19fb2e22af18f40d281d\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5d8e19fb2e22af18f40d281d&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn12@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-17-769_edf0fa9b5dde1c97.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/clusterstock/~4/tNw7bBMC8P0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn28@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-20-835_8835b3f3b6858fcb.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599296467312},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","title":"First-term Rep. Lizzie Fletcher looks to retain her seat against Wesley Hunt in Texas' 7th Congressional District","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/texas-7th-district-house-election-lizzie-fletcher-wesley-hunt-2020","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f3eab6f42f43f001ddfe10a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Lizzie Fletcher\" height=\"2484\" width=\"4969\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Reps. Lizzie Fletcher, D-Texas., and David Cicilline, D-R.I., attend a ceremony in the Capitols Emancipation Hall to mark the the 400th anniversary of the first-recorded forced arrival of enslaved African people, on Tuesday, September 10, 2019.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tom Williams/CQ-Roll Call, Inc via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>First-term Rep. Lizzie Fletcher will face Republican Wesley Hunt in Texas' 7th Congressional District.</li>\n<li>Fletcher defeated 9-term incumbent John Culberson in 2018 by five percentage points, making her the first woman to represent the district.</li>\n<li>The 7th District is one of the many suburban districts that have sharply trended away from Republicans in recent elections.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>&#160;</p><p>First-term Democratic <strong>Rep. Lizzie Fletcher</strong> looks to defend her seat against Republican challenger <strong>Wesley Hunt</strong> in Texas' 7th Congressional District.</p><h2>The candidates</h2><p>Fletcher, a Houston native, is a former business litigation attorney. She defeated 9-term incumbent John Culberson in 2018 by five percentage points, making her the first woman to represent the district and first Democrat to since 1967. Fletcher is endorsed by the Texas AFL-CIO, Planned Parenthood Action Fund, the Human Rights Campaign, and was previously endorsed in 2018 by the Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee.</p><p>Also from Houston, Hunt is a U.S. Army veteran with previous deployments in Iraq and Saudi Arabia. During his time in Saudi Arabia, Hunt served as a liaison officer between the U.S. Government and the Royal Saudi Land Forces Aviation Corps. Currently working in real estate, Hunt's <a href=\"https://wesleyfortexas.com/wesley-on-the-issues/\">campaign is centered on</a> defeating the Green New Deal, lowering taxes, and reducing healthcare costs.</p><h2>The district</h2><p>Texas' 7th Congressional District is located in Houston's western region. The district contains part of Harris County and the unincorporated cities of Bellaire, West University Place, Bunker Hill Village, Hedwig Village, Southside Place, Hunters Creek Village, and Piney Point Village. With a <a href=\"https://www.census.gov/mycd/?st=48&cd=07d=07\">median income of $73,000</a>, it is one of the wealthier districts in Texas.</p><p>The 7th District is one of the many upscale suburban districts that have trended away from Republicans in recent years as white, college-educated, and suburban voters sour on the GOP under President Donald Trump.&#160;</p><p>In 2012, Republican presidential nominee Mitt Romney carried the district easily by a margin of over 21 percentage points. But in 2016, the district voted for Democratic nominee Hillary Clinton by 1.4 percentage points, <a href=\"https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1whYBonfwlgTGnYl7U_IH31G0JNYQ9QBIjDfqkZHkW-0/edit#gid=0\">according to the Daily Kos.&#160;</a></p><p>In 2018, the same year that Fletcher was elected, Democratic US Senate candidate Beto O'Rourke <a href=\"https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1W_GTNylAZfboZkDeMsJPGlir3aQB64SzlVHjY9Xdnkk/edit#gid=562073942\">carried the district by seven points</a>, 53% to 46%, in his campaign against Sen. Ted Cruz.&#160;</p><h2>The money race</h2><p>According to the <a href=\"https://www.opensecrets.org/races/summary?cycle=2020&id=TX07TX07\">Center for Responsive Politics</a>, Fletcher has raised $4.3 million– about $1.2 million more than Hunt's $3.1 million raised. With $3.4 million in cash on hand, Fletcher also has over three times than Hunt, who has $1 million remaining.</p><h2>What some of the experts say</h2><p>The race between Fletcher and Hunt is rated as \"leans Democratic\" by <a href=\"https://insideelections.com/ratings/house\">Inside Elections</a>, <a href=\"https://cookpolitical.com/ratings/house-race-ratings\">The Cook Political Report</a>, and <a href=\"http://centerforpolitics.org/crystalball/2020-house/\">Sabato's Crystal Ball at the University of Virginia Center for Politics</a>.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article 17:01:07","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","title":"Everything you need to know about New York's 2nd congressional district race","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/new-york-2nd-district-house-election-andrew-garbarino-jackie-gordon-2020","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f3d496942f43f001ddfdc68?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GettyImages-women-vote\" height=\"512\" width=\"1024\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Women wearing masks pose behind a voter registration table in Union Square in New York City.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alexi Rosenfeld/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Republican Andrew Garbarino will face Democrat Jackie Gordon in New York's 2nd Congressional District.</li>\n<li>The district is located along Long Island's south coast and includes the southwestern region of Suffolk County and part of Nassau County.</li>\n<li>Gordon currently has $1.1 million in cash on hand, over ten times more than Garbarino.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>&#160;</p><p>Democrat <strong>Jackie Gordon</strong> and Republican <strong>Andrew Garbarino</strong> are each vying for the chance to represent New York's 2nd congressional district in the U.S. House of Representatives.</p><p>The seat is currently held by Republican <strong>Rep. Peter King</strong>. King has represented the state for fourteen terms and announced his <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/new-yorks-rep-king-becomes-20th-us-republican-to-exit-congress-2019-11\">plans to retire from the House</a> in November 2019.</p><h2>The candidates</h2><p>Gordon, a 29-year Army Reserve veteran, is a former public school educator and guidance counselor. She served on the Babylon Town Council for 13 years and worked with military families and veterans as the chair of the Veterans Advisory Council. Gordon is running on a <a href=\"https://jackiegordonforcongress.com/issues\">platform focusing on</a> increasing educational resources for teachers, lowering classroom sizes, assisting veterans, and combatting gun violence.</p><p>Garbarino, a lawyer and small business owner, currently represents the 7th district of the New York State Assembly – a position he has held since being first elected in 2012. His <a href=\"https://www.garbarinoforny.com/issues/\">campaign platform is centered on</a> combatting the current opiate crisis, protecting the natural environment of the Great South Bay and its waters, and supporting veterans.</p><h2>The district</h2><p>New York's 2nd Congressional District is located along the southern coast of Long Island in New York. The district is home to the southwestern region of Suffolk County and a small part of Nassau County.</p><p>This district flipped from voting for former President Barack Obama by four points in 2012 to backing President Donald Trump by nine points in 2016, <a href=\"https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1whYBonfwlgTGnYl7U_IH31G0JNYQ9QBIjDfqkZHkW-0/edit#gid=0\">according to the Daily Kos.&#160;</a></p><h2>The money race</h2><p>According to the <a href=\"https://www.opensecrets.org/races/summary?cycle=2020&id=NY02NY02\">Center for Responsive Politics</a>, Gordon has raised three times than Garbarino. Gordon has received $1.7 million in donations compared to Garbarino's $488,000. Garbarino has only $104,000 in remaining cash on hand, eleven times less than Gordon's $1.1 million in the bank.</p><h2>What experts say</h2><p>The race between Garbarino and Gordon is rated as a \"toss-up\" by <a href=\"https://insideelections.com/ratings/house\">Inside Elections</a> and <a href=\"https://cookpolitical.com/ratings/house-race-ratings\">The Cook Political Report</a>, and is rated as \"leans Republican\" by <a href=\"http://centerforpolitics.org/crystalball/2020-house/\">Sabato's Crystal Ball at the University of Virginia Center for Politics.</a></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/new-york-2nd-district-house-election-andrew-garbarino-jackie-gordon-2020'>Business Insider</a></div><div +0000","feedId":13983,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f3c42f542f43f001ddfda1a?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"f55bb977f16378e354d73796ad5cb9d5","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn21@2020_6/2020/09/05/09-01-12-761_24eab254a3b3da89.webp","destWidth":3464,"destHeight":2598,"sourceBytes":644662,"destBytes":644662,"author":"mhall@businessinsider.com (Madison Hall,Grace Panetta)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f3d496942f43f001ddfdc68?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn98@2020_6/2020/09/05/09-01-19-066_2ad84ed7b3d86eac.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn60@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-18-751_00f09200df8426be.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=enWEfe1awsI:IAtzLzSSfO4:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn77@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-14-413_cb5cbd1d8d4552d8.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=enWEfe1awsI:IAtzLzSSfO4:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn72@2020_5/2020/09/05/09-01-21-900_778a10c1073949c3.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=enWEfe1awsI:IAtzLzSSfO4:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn3@2020_5/2020/09/05/09-01-14-028_31dd792d36886f9d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn54@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-18-350_767e235117808cfa.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn12@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-17-769_edf0fa9b5dde1c97.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/clusterstock/~4/enWEfe1awsI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn90@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-20-628_79a0f0d3d27783c0.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599296467311},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","title":"The Apple Watch is finally getting 1 major feature it's been missing that Fitbit has offered for years. Here's everything we know about the next model so far.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/apple-watch-series-6-rumors-release-date-specs-features-2020-1","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e50176cfee23d361d7ed0e6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"time smart tech apple watch series 5 cox 17\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Apple Watch Series 5\n<p class=\"copyright\">Crystal Cox/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><a href=\"http://apple.sjv.io/c/196318/435031/7613?subId1=newsroom_affiliate_020320_apple-watch-series-6-rumors-release-date-specs-features&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fm%2F\" rel=\"nofollow\">Apple</a> is expected to release a new <a href=\"http://apple.sjv.io/c/196318/435031/7613?subId1=newsroom_affiliate_020320_apple-watch-series-6-rumors-release-date-specs-features&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fwatch%2Fh%2F\" rel=\"nofollow\">Apple Watch</a> in 2020, as it's done every year since 2015.</li><li>The biggest new addition to this year's watch is expected to be sleep tracking, a feature that would help Apple catch up to rivals like Fitbit and Samsung.</li><li>Otherwise, the next Apple Watch, which is expected to be called the Series 6, is rumored to come with faster performance and better water resistance.&#160;</li><li>Here's what else we know.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p><a href=\"http://apple.sjv.io/c/196318/435031/7613?subId1=newsroom_affiliate_020320_apple-watch-series-6-rumors-release-date-specs-features&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fm%2F\" rel=\"nofollow\">Apple</a> has released a new smartwatch every year since 2015, and there's a good chance 2020 will be no different.</p><p>While last year's <a href=\"http://apple.sjv.io/c/196318/435031/7613?subId1=newsroom_affiliate_020320_apple-watch-series-6-rumors-release-date-specs-features&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fwatch%2Fh%2F\" rel=\"nofollow\">Apple Watch</a> brought improvements like an always-on display and a built-in compass, the biggest update expected to arrive on Apple's popular smartwatch in 2020 is support for sleep tracking.</p><p>That seems more certain now that Apple has <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/apple-watch-sleep-tracking-app-announced-wwdc-fitbit-2020-6\">announced a new Sleep app</a> for the Apple Watch, which will be part of the company's new watch software update coming in the fall. The app will display a sleep analysis chart showing your sleeping pattern for the week, and leverages the Apple Watch's accelerometer to gather movement data that can be used to tell whether you're awake or asleep.&#160;</p><p>An <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-02-26/apple-is-said-to-plan-sleep-tracking-feature-for-future-watch\">early 2019 Bloomberg report</a> said that Apple could be rolling out sleep tracking features to its 2020 Apple Watch. It's unclear, however, if the new Sleep software is the extent of Apple's new sleep tracking functionality or if the company is planning to add new hardware to its future watch to further expand these capabilities.&#160;</p><p>Built-in sleep tracking has been the one major feature the Apple Watch was lacking, compared with rivals like Fitbit, which Google <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/googles-fitbit-deal-more-scrutiny-from-the-justice-department-2020-4\">agreed to acquire for $2.1 billion</a>, and Samsung. Previously, Apple Watch owners needed to download a third-party app to measure sleep.</p><p>Adding such a feature — and improving the Apple Watch's battery life to go along with it — could further establish Apple's stronghold on the smartwatch market.&#160;Apple was the top wearable device maker as of the first quarter of 2020, according to <a href=\"https://www.idc.com/getdoc.jsp?containerId=prUS46432620\">The International Data Corporation</a>, claiming 29.3% of the market, followed by Xiaomi, Samsung, Huawei, and Fitbit.&#160;</p><p>The launch would also come just after rival Fitbit launched a new smartwatch <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fitbit-sense-smartwatch-announced-stress-tracking-apple-watch-2020-8\">called the Sense</a> that it claims can measure the impact of stress on the body and a new version of its Versa watch.</p><p>Here's a look at everything we're expecting to see from Apple's next smartwatch.&#160;</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tApple will probably call it the Apple Watch Series 6.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e34562862fa812fdc55259a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Apple Watch\" height=\"1992\" width=\"2656\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Justin Sullivan/Getty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>If <a href=\"http://apple.sjv.io/c/196318/435031/7613?subId1=newsroom_affiliate_020320_apple-watch-series-6-rumors-release-date-specs-features&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2F\" rel=\"nofollow\">Apple</a> sticks with the branding it's used since 2016, we can expect its next smartwatch to be called the Apple Watch Series 6.&#160;</p>\n\tThe watch will probably be released in September.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e34542d62fa812d2f45da45?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Apple iPhone event 2019\" height=\"691\" width=\"921\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">apple</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Apple typically debuts its new <a href=\"http://apple.sjv.io/c/196318/435031/7613?subId1=newsroom_affiliate_020320_apple-watch-series-6-rumors-release-date-specs-features&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fwatch%2F\" rel=\"nofollow\">Apple Watch</a> alongside its refreshed iPhones in September, so it seems plausible that the company may take a similar approach this year. In years past, Apple has revealed the new watch on stage during its fall keynote and launched the device in stores later in September, usually roughly 10 days after the launch event.&#160;</p>\n\tApple just launched a sleep tracking app for the Apple Watch, hinting that perhaps more sleep-oriented features are coming in the next model.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3451a924306a1e116787c8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"sleeping in \" height=\"4347\" width=\"5796\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">People Images/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Apple is said to have been testing sleep tracking for the Apple Watch at its campus as of early 2019, according to <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-02-26/apple-is-said-to-plan-sleep-tracking-feature-for-future-watch?sref=BWbpWjRm\">Bloomberg's Mark Gurman.</a> It's unclear if this means the next Apple Watch will have additional sleep tracking features based on new hardware that extend beyond what will be available in watchOS 7's new Sleep app.&#160;</p><p>One thing it will need to keep up with rivals, however, is better battery life. Fitbit devices last for multiple days without requiring a charge, making it easy to wear them overnight without worrying about them running out of juice the next day. The Apple Watch, comparatively, typically needs to be charged every night.&#160;&#160;</p><p>Along with showing how much you've slept in the past week and monitoring the time you've spent asleep in the new Sleep app, the watch will also remind you to charge it when the battery dips below 30% in watchOS 7.&#160;</p><p>&#160;</p>\n\tThe next Apple Watch may be able to monitor blood-oxygen levels, too.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e666936fee23d726c1ea7b6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"time smart tech apple watch series 5 cox 14\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Crystal Cox/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Apple's next-generation smartwatch may be able to measure blood-oxygen saturation, a feature that Fitbit rolled out to some of its devices earlier this year, as <a href=\"https://9to5mac.com/2020/03/08/apple-watch-blood-oxygen-saturation/\">9to5Mac reported</a> after finding references to the capability in Apple's code.&#160;</p><p>With this feature, the watch would be able to notify users when their blood-oxygen saturation falls below a certain level, and the alerts would look similar to the heart-rate notifications currently available on the Apple Watch.&#160;</p><p>It's unclear if this feature will only be available in the Series 6 or if it would be capable of working on older watches as well.&#160;</p>\n\tApple may launch two new watches this year for the first time.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e501785a9f40c0b5970e8f3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"time smart tech apple watch series 5 cox 3\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Crystal Cox/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>In addition to the Apple Watch Series 6, Apple is also expected to release a second <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/apple-watch-series-6-rumors-cheaper-price-watch-launch-2020-9\">low-cost watch</a> to replace the Series 3, according to <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-01/apple-targets-75-million-5g-iphones-for-fall-product-blitz?sref=BWbpWjRm\">Bloomberg</a>.</p><p>Doing so could give Apple more ammunition to compete with rivals like Fitbit, which sells fitness-focused smartwatches and wristbands that usually undercut the price of Apple's latest watch.&#160;</p><p>&#160;</p>\n\tIt will probably look very similar to the Apple Watch Series 5 and Series 4.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e50176dfee23d3666393c65?format=jpeg\" alt=\"time smart tech apple watch series 5 cox 9\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Apple Watch Series 5\n<p class=\"copyright\">Crystal Cox/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>It doesn't sound like Apple is planning any major design changes for its next iteration of the Apple Watch, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/jon_prosser/status/1252769317185294336?s=19\">according to</a> gadget leaker and YouTube host Jon Prosser.&#160;</p><p>When asked on Twitter about what to expect from the next Apple Watch, Prosser, who correctly reported the iPhone SE's unveil date, said it will look the same as the Series 4.</p><p>Apple changed the design of its smartwatch in 2018 with the Series 4, which has a thinner case and a display that's 30% larger compared to the Series 3. It kept this design with the Series 5, and based on Prosser's tweet it seems as if it will do the same for the Series 6.</p>\n\tIt'll likely run on a new Apple processor and may offer faster performance.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/554259956bb3f71b6b009eed?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Apple Watch S1 chip\" height=\"591\" width=\"854\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"http://www.apple.com/watch/technology/\" target=\"_blank\">Apple</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Apple typically introduces a new processor in each new model of the Apple Watch, as it's done in years past. While there wasn't much of a performance boost when it came to speed between this year's Apple Watch and last year's, Apple said when announcing the Series 4 that it was capable of delivering twice the speed of its predecessor.&#160;</p><p>TF International Securities analyst Ming-Chi Kuo, who is known for his often accurate predictions about future Apple products, also said he expects the next-generation Apple Watch to offer faster performance, as <a href=\"https://www.macrumors.com/2019/11/11/apple-watch-series-6-faster-chip-kuo/?utm_source=feedly&#38;utm_medium=webfeeds\">MacRumors reported.</a> The wireless transmission speeds will also reportedly be faster on the next Apple Watch, says Kuo, which means we may see a boost in Wi-Fi and cellular performance.&#160;</p>\n\tThe next Apple Watch may offer better water resistance.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5a207ac13dbef4ae078b9432?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Apple Watch\" height=\"1332\" width=\"1776\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Hollis Johnson</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>You can already go swimming with the Apple Watch Series 2 or later, but Kuo suggests that the next-generation smartwatch will be more water-resistant than the current generation. He doesn't offer any specifics, however.</p><p>&#160;</p>\n\tThe Series 6 will run on the newest software from Apple.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cf58b7311e2051f0e6a9fa3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"watchos\" height=\"970\" width=\"1294\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Apple</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Apple's new smartwatches usually ship with the company's latest software, and there's little reason to believe 2020 will be any different.&#160;</p><p>The company unveiled watchOS 7 at its Worldwide Developers Conference last month, its next major software update launching in the fall. In addition to the new Sleep app, the upgrade will bring new features such as the ability to share custom watch faces with others, support for new workout types like dance, and handwashing detection among other new additions.&#160;</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 17:01:07","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","title":"Santa School trainees are learning how to celebrate a socially distanced Christmas with face shields and velvet masks","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/santa-school-christmas-coronavirus-ministry-of-fun-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f52b1fe7ed0ee001e25dae8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"BIT_Santa_School_V2.00_00_06_03.Still009\" height=\"1080\" width=\"1920\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Santa School trainees are learning how to spread Christmas cheer while following coronavirus health precautions.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Visits with Santa Claus might look different this year because of coronavirus health precautions.</li>\n<li>One Santa training school in the UK is teaching wannabe Kris Kringles bring Christmas cheer while social distancing and wearing protective equipment.</li>\n<li>Uncertainty around pandemic health guidelines have led to a drop in bookings at the Ministry of Fun's Santa School.</li>\n<li><strong><a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/BusinessInsiderToday/\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\">View more episodes of Business Insider Today on Facebook.</a></strong></li>\n</ul><div class=\"insider-raw-embed\"><iframe src=\"https://www.facebook.com/plugins/video.php?href=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2FBusinessInsiderToday%2Fvideos%2F321177358985619%2F&show_text=false&width=734&height=411&appId\" width=\"734\" height=\"411\" style=\"border:none;overflow:hidden\" scrolling=\"no\" frameborder=\"0\" allowtransparency=\"true\" allow=\"encrypted-media\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></iframe></div><p>Donning festive face shields and red velvet masks are just a couple ways performers at a professional Santa school are figuring out how to celebrate Christmas during a pandemic.</p><p>The <a href=\"http://www.ministryoffun.net/portfolio/santa-school-2017/\">Ministry of Fun</a>, an entertainment company in London, claims to have the longest-running Santa training school in the United Kingdom.</p><p>For 25 years, director James Lovell has been teaching wannabe Kris Kringles everything from reindeer names and costume design to how to handle fussy children.</p><p>This year, Christmas parties and Santa Claus visits will have to be coronavirus-safe, so Santa School started early to allow for training of a new set of skills.</p><p>\"We need to be able to reassure the nation and people that book Father Christmas that it is still possible to produce a Christmas grotto safely and magically,\" Lovell told Business Insider Today.</p><p>For one, Santa School students are learning how to manage long lines and enforce social distancing.&#160;</p><p>Instead of having kids sit with Santa, they'll be seated 2 meters away, and can take a gift from a small sled, completely contact-free.&#160;</p><p>\"We want everyone to know that, you know, all the precautions are set in place so that Santa's safe,\" one Santa trainee said. \"All the children are safe, and the adults are safe as well.\"</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f52b3d5e6ff30001d4e7455?format=jpeg\" alt=\"BIT_Santa_School_V2.00_00_11_25.Still006\" height=\"1080\" width=\"1920\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Ministry of Fun&#39;s Santa School is seeing fewer bookings this year because of the pandemic.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The Santa School usually gets up to 700 bookings by September ahead of Christmas season, but this year, it's only seen half that. Lovell&#160;says the British government has only made guidelines more confusing.</p><p>Movie theaters and museums are open in the UK, but fears of a second wave have left some hesitant to embrace a \"normal\" Christmas.&#160;</p><p>\"It's not that people have said no, it's just that they are hesitating about saying yes. There are a lot of mixed messages,\" Lovell said. \"People don't really know what they're supposed to be doing.\"</p><p>The director says families can rest assured that close contact with strangers can be easily avoided during a visit with Santa. And with all the coronavirus precautions and proper training in place, he's confident that Christmas won't be canceled this year.&#160;</p><p>\"You can't have Christmas without Santa. And so I'm hoping that after today, people will be reassured and we'll start booking them as they normally do,\" he said.</p><p>\"After everything that's happened this year, the magic of Father Christmas is more important than ever before, really. People need cheering up. I think more than ever this year, Father Christmas should be out there making people smile again.\"</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 17:01:07","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","title":"How to use your iPhone's keyboard as a trackpad and freely move the cursor for more efficient typing","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-use-iphone-keyboard-as-trackpad","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5290957ed0ee001e25da2c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Using iPhone\" height=\"1500\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Use your iPhone&#39;s keyboard as a trackpad to type more efficiently.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tomohiro Ohsumi/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>It's possible to use your iPhone's keyboard as a trackpad and easily move your cursor around when typing.</li>\n<li>Moving your cursor lets you insert text in different locations and make more precise edits to your writing.</li>\n<li>To use your iPhone keyboard as a trackpad, just press and hold your spacebar.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\" data-uri=\"4c86c1c3a45644bf07d168dc4c802e5e\"><strong>Visit Business Insider's Tech Reference library for more stories</strong></a><strong>.</strong></li>\n</ul><p>Every smartphone user out there knows the struggle of typing an entire message, realizing that you misspelled a word, and then struggling to get their cursor back in the right spot to fix it. More often than not, it's quicker to just delete the entire word and retype it.</p><p>What <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/iphone\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">iPhone</a> users may not realize is that there's actually an easier way to move the cursor around when typing — using the spacebar as a trackpad.</p><p>Here's how to do it.</p><h2><strong>How to use your iPhone's keyboard as a trackpad</strong></h2><p>This method works with any text box, as long as you're using the iPhone's default keyboard. Also note that this feature is only available on <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-version-of-ios-do-i-have\">iPhones running iOS 12 and newer</a>.&#160;</p><p><strong>1. </strong>Type any text box or area that you can type in. This can be your Notes app, a search bar, a text message — anywhere you can type.</p><p><strong>2. </strong>Press and hold one finger on the spacebar. All the other keys will gray out.</p><p><strong>3. </strong>Swipe your finger across the spacebar, and your cursor will move around the text area.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f528afee6ff30001d4e7369?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to use iPhone keyboard as trackpad   1\" height=\"1334\" width=\"750\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Press and hold on the spacebar, then swipe your finger around to turn the keyboard into a trackpad.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Melanie Weir/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>4. </strong>Move the cursor around until you have it where you need it, then let go of the spacebar to place your cursor and resume typing.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5d8e19fb2e22af18f40d281d\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5d8e19fb2e22af18f40d281d&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><h2><strong>Related coverage from&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"4c86c1c3a45644bf07d168dc4c802e5e\">Tech Reference</a>:</strong></h2><ul><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-turn-on-emergency-alerts-on-iphone\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"f3818923814cec68906cf670ab3dd42e\">How to turn on emergency alerts on your iPhone to stay aware of local emergencies and safety warnings<br></a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-use-iphone-as-digital-car-keys\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"79d781203c63db925c9286cae996011a\">How to use your iPhone as digital car keys if you have a compatible vehicle</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/iphone-keyboard-shortcuts\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"3a3c04d2b1b218796ed6195795e4922c\">How to use keyboard shortcuts on your iPhone or create your own, to type faster and more accurately</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/does-your-iphone-charge-faster-on-low-power-mode\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"6ebce7a86cac7e5fbd9d7c42945a271b\">Does your iPhone charge faster on Low Power Mode? 17:01:07","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","title":"Where to buy toilet paper online during coronavirus-related shortages","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/where-to-buy-toilet-paper-online","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from our affiliate partners. <a href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e68ef54e4f9fe30551c0dd5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"toilet paper\" height=\"3019\" width=\"4026\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Shutterstock</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>As a reaction to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/china-virus-everything-we-know-deadly-2019-ncov-wuhan-spread-2020-1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the novel coronavirus</a>, many people are <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/walmart-amazon-target-selling-out-of-toilet-paper-online-2020-3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">stocking up on toilet paper</a>, causing shortages and price gouging at both online and brick-and-mortar stores.&#160;</li><li><strong>Though we don't encourage panic buying and hoarding, we were able to find affordable purchase options for toilet paper online.&#160;&#160;</strong></li><li>As of 9/4/20, many stores have restocked toilet paper but we've seen availability come in and out so we've left the links in the story for your convenience.&#160;</li><li>See more: <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/where-to-buy-affordable-latex-gloves\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Where to buy disposable latex gloves</a>&#160;</li></ul><p>Toilet paper, like <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-hand-sanitizers\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">hand sanitizer</a> and face masks, is running out at many stores.</p><p>Even though toilet paper doesn't protect against <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/china-virus-everything-we-know-deadly-2019-ncov-wuhan-spread-2020-1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the novel coronavirus or its symptoms</a>, our desire to keep a steady supply of household essentials, perhaps to regain a sense of control in times of uncertainty, <a href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/03/09/health/toilet-paper-shortages-novel-coronavirus-trnd/index.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">is a natural one</a>.&#160;</p><p>As stores like <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/coronavirus-walmart-may-cut-store-hours-and-limit-sales-2020-3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Walmart start limiting the number of high-demand items like toilet paper</a> at their physical locations, and more people are staying at home, shopping online is increasingly enticing. The only problem — and it's a big one — is that many popular online stores are also completely out of stock or offering overpriced products from third-party sellers.&#160;</p><p>We advise against <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/walmart-amazon-target-selling-out-of-toilet-paper-online-2020-3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">stockpiling toilet paper</a> beyond reason so everyone can get fair access to the supplies they need; see <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/coronavirus-water-toilet-paper-stockpile-not-necessary-2020-3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">why two experts say that's more harmful than helpful here</a>. To protect yourself effectively against the coronavirus, the <a href=\"https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/about/prevention.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommends</a> washing your hands often for at least 20 seconds each time, avoiding close contact with people who are sick or if you yourself are sick, and disinfecting frequently touched surfaces daily.&#160;</p><p>We also caution against buying products at marked-up prices if you can avoid it. The increased prices are a result of hoarding and product shortages. Manufacturers have said <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/purell-hand-sanitizer-sells-out-amazon-coronavirus-fears-2020-2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">they'll work to address production shortages</a>, so we expect to see more availability and normal prices.</p><p>That said, in our frequent searches these past few months, there have been a few online retailers offering quality toilet paper. In our search, we looked at Amazon, Target, Boxed, FreshDirect, Walmart, Grove Collaborative, and Home Depot, among other retailers. It's unlikely you'll find your favorite brand at the usual suspects consistently (Amazon, Target), but other retailers you might not immediately think of (Rite Aid, Staples) may still have toilet paper in stock.</p><p>Prices and links are accurate as of publishing time and we'll do our best to keep this list updated with affordable in-stock purchase options.&#160;</p><h2>Here's where you can buy toilet paper online:&#160;</h2><p><em>Note: As of 9/3/20, the following options are in stock online or available in stores, though availability depends on your zip code so inventory can change. Chen)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5e68ef54e4f9fe30551c0dd5?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn79@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-18-894_2496ff59a1ddb2ef.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn60@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-18-751_00f09200df8426be.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=IHnszATFDkc:4Q5F9vN6vyQ:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn32@2020_5/2020/09/05/09-01-15-117_7eea239c1d469bb2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=IHnszATFDkc:4Q5F9vN6vyQ:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn12@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-24-812_41b236d07cb68cdb.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=IHnszATFDkc:4Q5F9vN6vyQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn83@2020_5/2020/09/05/09-01-18-451_fea401440ca37812.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn54@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-18-350_767e235117808cfa.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn12@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-17-769_edf0fa9b5dde1c97.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/clusterstock/~4/IHnszATFDkc":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn28@2020_2/2020/09/05/09-01-14-988_30854c076e8e8db6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599296467313},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","title":"Boris Johnson told to take his 'head out of the sand' and avoid a double winter crisis of Brexit and the coronavirus","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/brexit-labour-rachel-reeves-boris-johnson-deal-winter-chaos-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f52489d7ed0ee001e25d7c6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Rachel Reeves Labour Party\" height=\"1447\" width=\"2894\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Labour MP Rachel Reeves arrives to attend a meeting at Cabinet Office on Whitehall in London on January 22, 2019.\n<p class=\"copyright\">TOLGA AKMEN/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The Labour Party is urging Boris Johnson's government to avert a national crisis this winter of damage done by the coronavirus compounded by chaotic exit from the European Union.</li>\n<li>Concern is growing among British businesses about the disruption that potentially awaits the UK at the end of the Brexit transition period.</li>\n<li>UK and EU negotiators are a long way from striking a trade deal before the transition period expires.</li>\n<li>Labour's Rachel Reeves said her opposite number Michael Gove needed to \"remove his head from the sand\" and listen to concerns about the damage a no-deal exit would do.</li>\n<li>\"Large parts of the economy are already on their knees and the last thing they need is another shock to the system,\" she told Business Insider in an interview.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Boris Johnson's government has been urged by the opposition Labour party to remove its \"head from the sand\" and negotiate a close trading relationship with the European Union in order to avoid a double Brexit crisis of border chaos and food shortages in the coming winter.</p><p>Rachel Reeves, Labour's Shadow Chancellor of the Duchy of Lancaster, told Business Insider in an interview this week that the UK government is leading the country into a potentially disastrous New Year.</p><p>She said the economic damage caused by the coronavirus outbreak risks being compounded by an abrupt exit from the EU's trading rules.</p><p>Reeves, the opposite number to Michael Gove, the UK minister responsible for preparing Britain for the end of the Brexit transition period, warned that \"business, consumers, and families have gone through a torrid year and can't afford anymore disruption.\"</p><p>The member of Parliament for Leeds West spoke to Business Insider after a week in which the scale of potential disruption facing Britain when it leaves the Brexit transition period at the end of the year became clearer.</p><p>Eleven logistics companies wrote to Gove, demanding an urgent meeting with him and Rishi Sunak, the Chancellor of the Exchequer, amid growing concern within the logistics industry that Britain's borders will not be ready in time for January 1, <a href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/49af99f3-4669-4654-a444-4e5e9635791c?shareType=nongift\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The Financial Times reported</a>.</p><p>Gove was also warned by government officials that there are \"critical gaps\" in plans to prepare borders and businesses for the end of the transition period, <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-03/u-k-races-to-fix-critical-gaps-exposed-in-brexit-border-plan\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">according to Bloomberg</a>, particularly crucial IT systems that will handle the movement of lorries to and from the EU.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/brexit-food-companies-warn-boris-johnson-has-missed-labelling-deadline-2020-9?r=US&IR=TIR=T\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Business Insider reported</a> that Britain's food industry has warned Johnson's government that the deadline for producing new labels needed to legally sell food to the EU and Northern Ireland from next year has already passed.</p><p>On Friday, a spokesperson for Prime Minister Johnson sought to calm fears that the UK would not be ready to break away from its biggest trading partner.</p><p>\"We have been clear since we left the EU that after the end of the Brexit transition period there will be changes and things companies need to implement,\" they said. That's why we have been working with them throughout the transition period and will continue to do so.\"</p><p>However, Reeves accused Gove and the rest of the Conservative government of failing to prepare the country.</p><p>\"Michael Gove is a little bit like an ostrich with his head in the sand. He doesn't seem to be willing to accept the reality of what's around him,\" she told Business Insider.</p><p>\"It's faith-based policy based on the belief that Brexit will be a world of sunny uplands.</p><p>\"The lack of preparedness and 'everything will be alright' approach is ostrich-like. If he removed his head from the sand he'd hear what businesses, which have already got a lot on their plate at the moment, are saying.\"</p><p>She accused the ministers of a lack of transparency around work to prepare Britain for life outside of the UK, amid frustration among British business groups with the lack of government guidance with just four months to go until the end of the transition.</p><p>\"It is a bit of a running theme with this government that it thinks consultation and dialogue is a barrier to delivery, when actually it is essential,\" Reeves said.</p><p>\"Let's take <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/brexit-boris-johnson-uk-lorry-parks-chaos-checks-2020-9?r=US&IR=TIR=T\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the lorry parks</a>: the government is rushing through these plans using a statutory instrument without any consultation with local authorities to build potentially 29 of them.</p><p>\"When I went to the one being built in Ashford in Kent, people were coming down and saying 'until the diggers were here, we had no idea what was happening.' It was totally out of the blue for them.\"</p><p>She warned that the government's furlough scheme for workers affected by COVID-19 is due to expire in the autumn and unemployment set to rise. \"Large parts of the economy are already on their knees and the last thing they need is another shock to the system\" caused by a chaotic exit from the EU.</p><p>UK and EU negotiators will hold the next round of formal talks over a free trade deal in London next week <a href=\"https://www.thetimes.co.uk/edition/comment/johnson-sees-no-deal-as-better-than-surrender-t5sf30chw\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">amid reports </a>that figures in Downing Street believe the chances of a deal before the autumn deadline are now less than 50%.</p><p>However, while a deal would potentially remove tariffs and other friction, with Britain leaving the EU's single market and customs union, there will be new checks and trade barriers, whatever the outcome of negotiations.</p><h2>Reeves puts pressure on Johnson to drop Tony Abbott</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f525e17e6ff30001d4e71e7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Michael Gove\" height=\"600\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">David Nash/Barcroft Media via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>With an eye on new free trade agreements with non-EU countries, Johnson's government has appointed former Australian prime minister Tony Abbott as an advisor on UK trade policy.</p><p>However, the prospect of Abbott's appointment has prompted outrage across the political spectrum, with opposition MPs and even some in Johnson's Conservative party arguing that Abbott's history of allegedly sexist and homophobic remarks make him unsuitable for the job. He has also <a href=\"http://tonyabbott.com.au/2017/10/transcript-hon-tony-abbott-mp-address-global-warming-policy-foundation-westminster-london/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">previously described</a> climate science as \"absolute crap.\"</p><p>Trade experts have accused Abbott of lacking the qualifications to advise on trade, pointing to <a href=\"https://www.spectator.co.uk/article/no-deal-no-problem\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">his claim</a> that a no-deal exit from the EU would be \"no problem\" for Britain.</p><p>Reeves, like Labour Party leader <a href=\"https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/keir-starmer-tony-abbott-brexit-trade-board-today-a9702836.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Keir Starmer</a> and <a href=\"https://labour.org.uk/press/abbott-cant-be-trusted-with-british-car-industry-says-thornberry/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Emily Thornberry</a>, the shadow trade secretary, said she was strongly opposed to his appointment.</p><p>\"When he was prime minister of Australia he oversaw the decimation of the car industry in his own country. I'm not sure that his track record of promoting business is that good,\" she told Business Insider.</p><p>\"To represent our country and it's great diversity, with someone who holds racist, misogynistic, and homophobic views, is not the message or the image of Britain that we want to portray around the world.</p><p>\"Many of our businesses are led by people from a whole range of backgrounds and I think they'll be disappointed and shocked to know that Tony Abbott will be representing us around the world.</p><p>\"Next year we will be hosting the climate conference in Glasgow and the guy's a climate denier. If Britain wants to show global leadership in tackling the climate emergency, I don't see how Tony Abbott is qualified to do that job.\"</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/clusterstock/~4/JMVAxiZwSS0\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 05 Sep 2020 08:58:00 +0000","feedId":13983,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f526bd37ed0ee001e25d8fa?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"0c684c7586119a72625a406fcd5d2cff","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn93@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-12-726_b6cb9237842eba28.webp","destWidth":865,"destHeight":649,"sourceBytes":64168,"destBytes":64168,"author":"apayne@businessinsider.com (Adam Payne)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f52489d7ed0ee001e25d7c6?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn58@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-19-574_fe1436fed2685cc5.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f525e17e6ff30001d4e71e7?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn78@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-15-305_1d5dbffc55a90f8d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn60@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-18-751_00f09200df8426be.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=JMVAxiZwSS0:53yHl4x-jEA:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn81@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-15-199_a70335969f8027a7.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=JMVAxiZwSS0:53yHl4x-jEA:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn3@2020_6/2020/09/05/09-01-22-928_250ecf1ea642a552.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=JMVAxiZwSS0:53yHl4x-jEA:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn96@2020_2/2020/09/05/09-01-18-586_c9c3b0615db4c448.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn54@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-18-350_767e235117808cfa.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn12@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-17-769_edf0fa9b5dde1c97.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/clusterstock/~4/JMVAxiZwSS0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn24@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-20-876_7446981de14f8c64.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599296467306},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","title":"How to use Sign In with Apple to log into websites and apps with your Apple ID","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-use-sign-in-with-apple","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f52ae1ae6ff30001d4e7434?format=jpeg\" alt=\"sign in with apple iphone\" height=\"690\" width=\"1380\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>It&#39;s easy to use the Sign In with Apple feature.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Apple; skitching by William Antonelli</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>To use Sign In with Apple, you simply need to select the option when asked to log into a participating app or website.</li>\n<li>Selecting the Sign In with Apple option will let you log into a service using your Apple ID username and password.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\" data-uri=\"4c86c1c3a45644bf07d168dc4c802e5e\">Visit Business Insider's Tech Reference library for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>If you've signed up for a website or app lately, you've probably noticed that most sites and apps offer you the option to sign in with Google or Facebook. If you choose one of those options, instead of creating new login information, you can use your pre-existing accounts to sign in.</p><p>Now, many sites let you do this with your Apple ID too. In this case, you'll use your Apple ID information to sign in.</p><p>Apple <a href=\"https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT210318\">claims</a> that their version of this service is more secure than others. They have strict privacy rules, which can prevent untrustworthy websites from tracking you.</p><p>If you want to use the Sign in with Apple feature, you'll need to be using an Apple device running iOS 13 or later, or your computer. You'll also need to have two-factor authentication enabled on your Apple ID, and if you're using an Apple device, you must be signed into iCloud.</p><h2><strong>How to use Sign In with Apple on an iPhone or iPad</strong></h2><p><strong>1. </strong>On the app or site you want to sign up for, look for a button that says \"Continue with Apple\" or \"Sign in with Apple.\" Tap it to continue.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f52a9f77ed0ee001e25daad?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to sign in with Apple   1\" height=\"1334\" width=\"750\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tap the &#34;Sign in With Apple&#34; button.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Melanie Weir/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>2. </strong>After you use Face ID, Touch ID, or your device's passcode to confirm your identity, your information will autofill into the necessary fields.</p><p>At this step, you can also select whether or not you want to use Apple's Hide My Email service. This service makes it so third-party services can't send you spam.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f52ab0ee6ff30001d4e741e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to sign in with Apple   2\" height=\"1334\" width=\"750\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Ensure that your information is correct, and choose whether or not you want to use Hide My Email.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Melanie Weir/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>3 </strong>Use Face ID, Touch ID, or your device's passcode to complete the signup process.</p><h2><strong>How to use Sign in with Apple on a computer</strong></h2><p><strong>1. </strong>Open the website you'd like to sign up for and choose \"Apple\" where the site offers alternate sign-in options.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f52ab507ed0ee001e25dabe?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to sign in with Apple   3\" height=\"754\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Select &#34;Apple&#34; from the list of alternate sign-in options.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Melanie Weir/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>2. </strong>Enter your Apple ID username and password.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f52ab8be6ff30001d4e7424?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to sign in with Apple   4\" height=\"831\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Enter your Apple ID information.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Melanie Weir/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>3. </strong>A verification code will be sent to your Apple device. Enter that code on the computer, then continue.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f52abf5e6ff30001d4e7429?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to sign in with Apple   5\" height=\"829\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Enter the verification code sent to your Apple device.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Melanie Weir/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>4. </strong>If you trust the device and browser you're using, and you don't want to have to use a verification code next time you log in, click \"Trust\" before continuing. If not, click \"Don't Trust.\" If you're not sure, click \"Not Now.\"</p><p><strong>5. </strong>Click \"Continue'\" to confirm your Apple ID and finish logging in.</p><h2>Related coverage from&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"4c86c1c3a45644bf07d168dc4c802e5e\">Tech Reference</a>:</h2><ul><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-block-emails-on-icloud\" data-analytics-position=\"1\" data-analytics-module=\"\">How to block emails on iCloud and automatically delete incoming spam messages</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-manage-icloud-storage-on-mac\" data-analytics-position=\"8\" data-analytics-module=\"\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"c2b5245eb9107c1e5238ff9e340759eb\">How to manage your iCloud storage on a Mac computer and buy additional gigabytes</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-get-icloud-storage\" data-analytics-position=\"12\" data-analytics-module=\"\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"825b3ca640897bec04056a50d09f9008\">How to get iCloud storage on your iPhone, MacBook, or iPad</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-reset-your-apple-id-password\" data-analytics-position=\"2\" data-analytics-module=\"\">How to reset your Apple ID password in 3 different ways if you've forgotten it or lost your device</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-log-out-of-icloud-on-mac\" data-analytics-position=\"19\" data-analytics-module=\"\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"ad4755480b0939b071f0bb889a98910f\">How to log out of your iCloud account on a Mac computer</a></h3></li></ul><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original 21:40:00 +0000","feedId":13983,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f52ae0ee6ff30001d4e7433?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"a8f7dd93d704ae66a1193d00364ffc73","destWidth":1269,"destHeight":952,"sourceBytes":10358,"destBytes":10358,"author":"insider@insider.com (Melanie Weir)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f52ae1ae6ff30001d4e7434?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn34@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-24-016_64bf8852891184f2.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f52a9f77ed0ee001e25daad?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn99@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-17-638_6b98be88245d7b00.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f52ab0ee6ff30001d4e741e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn18@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-21-500_81e407aa1dac337b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f52ab507ed0ee001e25dabe?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn91@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-17-618_62bbff4ed4e34490.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f52ab8be6ff30001d4e7424?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn23@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-23-871_8a10b8b3b8c87575.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f52abf5e6ff30001d4e7429?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn51@2020_2/2020/09/05/09-01-22-598_b87e6e9b7e338a47.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn60@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-18-751_00f09200df8426be.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=XS2qvkD4bv8:56for6qR_8U:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn76@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-23-803_803658ce8b328bb2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=XS2qvkD4bv8:56for6qR_8U:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn20@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-17-820_9ab2bdadf7de9287.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=XS2qvkD4bv8:56for6qR_8U:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn77@2020_5/2020/09/05/09-01-20-589_8d7ae9ffd07e54ae.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn54@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-18-350_767e235117808cfa.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn12@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-17-769_edf0fa9b5dde1c97.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/clusterstock/~4/XS2qvkD4bv8":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn95@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-19-774_7d262acbd3748a10.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599296467306},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","title":"A coffee company in the UK is teaching inmates barista skills so they can find work on the outside","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/redemption-roasters-coffee-prison-inmates-barista-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f52a218e6ff30001d4e73ed?format=jpeg\" alt=\"formark3\" height=\"1080\" width=\"1920\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Redemption Roasters claims to be the world&#39;s first &#34;behind-bars coffee company.&#34;\n<p class=\"copyright\">Robert Leslie/Business Insider Today</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Coffee company Redemption Roasters runs barista courses in UK prisons and offers employment to former convicts after release.</li>\n<li>Having a home and a job to return to has been proven to reduce the recidivism rate &#8212; one of the key goals of the company.</li>\n<li>In England and Wales, around half of those released from prison reoffend within a year.</li>\n<li><strong><a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/BusinessInsiderToday/\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\">View more episodes of Business Insider Today on Facebook.</a></strong></li>\n</ul><div class=\"insider-raw-embed\"><iframe src=\"https://www.facebook.com/plugins/video.php?href=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2FBusinessInsiderToday%2Fvideos%2F2647818082136221%2F&show_text=false&width=734&height=411&appId\" width=\"734\" height=\"411\" style=\"border:none;overflow:hidden\" scrolling=\"no\" frameborder=\"0\" allowtransparency=\"true\" allow=\"encrypted-media\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></iframe></div><p>Behind razor wire and high prison fences, a vast coffee roaster is helping reduce the rate of reoffending.</p><p>The 70-kilogram-capacity machine inside a training facility at The Mount prison near London provides inmates with the roasting and barista skills which, it's hoped, will find them employment after release.</p><p>The arabica beans prepared here make their way to wholesale customers and to the shops of the appropriately named <a href=\"https://www.redemptionroasters.com/\">Redemption Roasters</a>, which claims to be the world's first behind-bars coffee company.</p><p>Cutting the recidivism rate through coffee is the company's aspiration. And for ex-offender Darren Russen, it's working.</p><p>Russen received his four-week training with Redemption Roasters at Wormwood Scrubs prison in London. He started working as a barista at one of the company's six coffee shops after his release last year.</p><p>\"I've spent around 16 years in prison altogether,\" Russen told Business Insider Today. \"This is the first time in my life that I've seen something that's progressing people in prison and changing lives.\"</p><p>Russen said he was brought up into a life of crime, and served multiple prison sentences before he had the chance to learn about coffeemaking.</p><p>\"It's changed my whole outlook on life now, and it's progressing me,\" he said. \"It's the first time in my life I've been free basically, and that's through the support of the company and working. Just feeling a part and feeling happy. Getting up, waking up, and feeling a part of life.\"</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f52a26e7ed0ee001e25da89?format=jpeg\" alt=\"darren prison coffee\" height=\"1080\" width=\"1920\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Darren Russen is one of 17 former inmates who gained barista skills through the Redemption Roasters program in the past year.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Robert Leslie/Business Insider Today</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Redemption Roasters cofounder Max Dubiel already ran a coffee company when he was approached by the UK's Ministry of Justice to come up with a behind-bars barista training program.</p><p>\"Ultimately it's the right thing, because it takes people out of this vicious cycle of reoffending, which costs the taxpayer a hell of a lot of money,\" Dubiel told Business Insider. \"Even worse, it makes communities less safe, and also creates victims. And I think we all need to do our bit to reduce it in this country.\"</p><p>The reality is that most offenders simply don't have this kind of opportunity, either before or after release.</p><p>Having a job to go to can often mean the difference between going straight and reoffending.</p><p>\"Less than a fifth of offenders leave prison with a job to go to, and yet those who do have a job to go to are nine percentage points less likely to reoffend,\" said Laura Sapwell, the former governor of Aylesbury, a young offenders prison where Redemption Roasters runs a training program.</p><p>The reoffending rate for England and Wales is <a href=\"https://wellcomeopenresearch.org/articles/4-28/v1\">one of the highest in Europe</a>, according to a recent study. And almost half of all those released from prison commit another crime within a year, <a href=\"http://www.prisonreformtrust.org.uk/Portals/0/Documents/Bromley%20Briefings/Prison%20the%20facts%20Summer%202019.pdf\">according to the Prison Reform Trust</a>.</p><p>It cost around <a href=\"https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/750185/costs-per-place-costs-per-prisoner-2017-2018-summary.pdf\">40,000 pounds</a>, or $53,000, to provide each space in prison in the UK.</p><p>\"Having a stable home to go to and having a job does make a massive difference to the reoffending rate,\" Paul Crossey, deputy governor of The Mount prison, said.</p><p>\"When you've got a company that can offer jobs outside, they're already getting to know the men that they are working with in here. It breaks down a lot of barriers that maybe an employer who doesn't understand what prison is like would really know.\"</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f52a2847ed0ee001e25da8a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"prison coffee\" height=\"1080\" width=\"1920\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Lowering the recidivism rate by giving inmates job skills is one of the goals of the company.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Robert Leslie/Business Insider Today</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The high-tech facility at The Mount can roast up to 70 kilograms of coffee at a time — that's 7,000 kilograms a week.</p><p>Trainees are also taught about the origins of coffee, tasting, and appreciation, as well as grinding, extraction, and milk technique.</p><p>So far, more than 400 prisoners have been through the training program here and at nine other prison sites in England and Wales. In the last year, 17 have been hired in the coffee industry after release.</p><p>But training is often not enough. The stigma of a criminal record and the fear of hiring an ex-offender can be huge obstacles to finding work on the outside — as can a lack of qualifications and low levels of literacy.</p><p>Dubiel, for one, sees only positives in hiring ex-offenders.</p><p>\"One does, by employing an ex-offender, hire an incredibly loyal workforce, hire somebody who's incredibly thankful and keen to develop their career with you,\" he said.</p><p>Meanwhile, prison walls have provided no shelter from the coronavirus pandemic. For months, those who were locked up were also locked down, with training behind-bars training schemes suspended.</p><p>But coffee shops are reopening.&#160;</p><p>For Russen, this is the first time in his life he's managed to see out his yearlong license, or probation period, after release from prison.</p><p>\"I've always broken my license. I've lasted a year or just over a year, or just over a year, then prison. That's been my cycle for years, but I've actually broken that cycle now. It's making me grow. It's making me feel stronger as well.\"</p><p>He added: \"It's the customers. It's just meeting people as well. The coffee is great, but it's building relationships — I'm really becoming part of society, and I'm feeling part of, for the first time in my life, of London, and part of society.\"</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/redemption-roasters-coffee-prison-inmates-barista-2020-9'>Business Insider</a></div><div
