+0000","feedId":13983,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f4964f77ffa48002894cf70?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"d229c51169f13d877cf249a6648d7e4d","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn18@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-07-473_3201e18129950357.webp","destWidth":1885,"destHeight":1414,"sourceBytes":88966,"destBytes":88966,"author":"insider@insider.com (Dave Johnson)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f4964f77ffa48002894cf70?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn18@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-07-473_3201e18129950357.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f4961907ffa48002894cf67?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn88@2020_5/2020/09/05/09-01-19-921_b2233c5c36b32886.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f4961bc60bf1f00280794e6?format=jpeg":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn60@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-18-751_00f09200df8426be.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=UTWquhfhslE:MWmscuhVnhE:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn55@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-16-517_a6f7efebddd1df90.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=UTWquhfhslE:MWmscuhVnhE:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn100@2020_5/2020/09/05/09-01-23-865_9a9f0cd3be8e7c2c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=UTWquhfhslE:MWmscuhVnhE:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn81@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-16-711_75aa58531c886228.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn54@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-18-350_767e235117808cfa.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn12@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-17-769_edf0fa9b5dde1c97.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/clusterstock/~4/UTWquhfhslE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn22@2020_5/2020/09/05/09-01-19-345_9409d166dac6c077.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599296467318},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","title":"Rocket Lab just launched its first spacecraft, transforming a leftover piece of its rocket into a satellite that can carry missions to the moon or Venus","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/rocket-lab-launches-photon-satellite-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f10a573f34d05715554a784?format=jpeg\" alt=\"rocket lab Electron vehicle orbital launcher ELaNa19 liftoff zealand launch Trevor Mahlmann rocketlab\" height=\"787\" width=\"1050\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>One of Rocket Lab&#39;s carbon-fiber Electron launch vehicles lifts off from New Zealand.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.rocketlabusa.com/gallery/\" target=\"_blank\">Trevor Mahlmann/Rocket Lab</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/rocket-lab-vehicle-fails-to-reach-orbit-loses-payload-of-satellites-2020-7\">Rocket Lab</a> just launched its first Photon satellite: a spacecraft designed for missions to the moon, Venus, or Mars.</li>\n<li>This spacecraft, called \"First Light,\" is just a demo, but NASA has already contracted Rocket Lab to fly the agency's robotic moon mission in 2021.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/rocket-lab-ceo-peter-beck-electron-failure-photon-lunar-spacecraft-2020-7\">CEO Peter Beck</a> says that, together, the Electron rocket and Photon spacecraft can cut out the most difficult parts of sending satellite missions to other planets.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Rocket Lab — a private rocket company&#160;— quietly launched its own satellite for the first time this week.</p><p>Rocket Lab has been launching other firms' satellites aboard its Electron rocket since 2018, but it has never put its own spacecraft into Earth's orbit before.</p><p>But the spacecraft it launched this week, the first demo of its own Photon satellite, is designed to carry other companies' and government agencies' technology into space. Eventually, it could carry missions to the moon, Venus, and Mars.</p><p>Monday's launch at first appeared routine, like the 13 missions Rocket Lab previously launched. The company's Electron rocket lifted off from its New Zealand launch complex on Monday, shedding its unneeded sections as it roared through the atmosphere. About an hour later, the remaining section of the rocket, called the kick stage, made a final push into an orbit high above Earth and deployed a microsatellite for the company Capella Space — a Rocket Lab customer.&#160;</p><p>But then something totally new happened: Instead of firing its boosters to push itself back into Earth's atmosphere, where it would disintegrate, the kick stage settled into its own orbit and entered satellite mode.</p><p>\"There was a real magical moment, sitting with the engineers, where we sent a command to the kick stage ... a command that turned the kick stage into our very first satellite,\" Rocket Lab CEO Peter Beck said in a <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zC8RxgL9tK4&feature=youtu.beu.be\">video</a> announcement on Thursday.</p><p>The company hopes that Photon will extend its launch service to include a spaceflight service — taking its customers' satellite missions not only past Earth's atmosphere but beyond to other planets. All the customer has to do is make its hardware fit onboard Photon.</p><p>If successful, the project could make Rocket Lab an end-to-end satellite flight company. That would give it a unique role in the new commercial era of space, where private companies launch, fly, and land spacecraft for government agencies like NASA.</p><p>With the help of companies like Rocket Lab, NASA plans to eventually establish <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nasa-10-year-plan-lunar-base-saturn-moon-2019-7\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\" data-uri=\"45ba87a921c8d1de0d449b73070abc4b\">a permanent moon base, and then potentially spring-board missions from there to Mars</a>.</p><h2>Future Photons could travel to other planets — and one is booked for the moon</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f52777ce6ff30001d4e72e4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"rocket lab Photon satellite First Light launch\" height=\"1407\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A photo from Rocket Lab&#39;s first Photon Satellite, &#34;First Light,&#34; in Earth&#39;s orbit.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Rocket Lab</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Rocket Lab shared its plan to create the new satellite, called Photon, last year. The disk-shaped, single-motor spacecraft is designed to carry missions for other companies to the moon, Venus, and even Mars — it's equipped with solar cells and navigation hardware.</p><p>This was its first launch.</p><p>Rocket Lab dubbed the new spacecraft \"First Light.\" Beck told reporters that it would remain in orbit for the next five to six years.</p><p>\"This first Photon mission is really focused as a technology demonstrator, to prove out all the systems and the operations — everything we need to take us to the moon and Venus and beyond,\" Beck said. \"It also provides an opportunity for our customers who are interested in Photon to actually take a look at what we've built.\"</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f1097f2aee6a848cf58c878?format=jpeg\" alt=\"photo spacecraft platform rocket lab rocketlab 00002.JPG\" height=\"1503\" width=\"2004\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Rocket Lab&#39;s Photon spacecraft (right) is designed to ride atop an Electron rocket&#39;s second stage (left) and fly missions to high orbits and even the moon.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.rocketlabusa.com/news/updates/link-to-rocket-lab-imagery-and-video/\" target=\"_blank\">Rocket Lab</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Once the service is up and running, customers should be able to buy a ready-made Photon spacecraft, load it up with the instruments for their mission, and pay Rocket Lab to launch it into space.</p><p>From there, the satellite can set itself on a path that takes&#160;it as far as the moon or Venus, or even Mars.</p><p>\"Launching the first Photon mission marks a major turning point for space users – it's now easier to launch and operate a space mission than it has ever been,\" Beck said in a <a href=\"https://www.rocketlabusa.com/about-us/updates/media-release-rocket-lab-launches-first-in-house-designed-and-built-photon-satellite/\">statement</a>. \"When our customers choose a launch-plus-spacecraft mission with Electron and Photon, they immediately eliminate the complexity, risk, and delays associated with having to build their own satellite hardware and procure a separate launch.\"</p><p>NASA already plans to use the 55-pound, $13.7 million Photon spacecraft to fly a robotic moon mission called CAPSTONE (short for \"Cislunar Autonomous Positioning System Technology Operations and Navigation Experiment\"). In February, <a href=\"https://www.nasa.gov/press-release/nasa-awards-contract-to-launch-cubesat-to-moon-from-virginia\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"cdf687a4137431370e54754adca9a08f\">NASA awarded Rocket Lab a $9.95 million contract</a>. The mission is supposed to launch in 2021 and spend a few months winding its way into lunar orbit as a demonstration — part of NASA's Artemis moon-landing program.</p><p>Rocket Lab announced on Thursday that it has opened a new manufacturing facility in Long Beach, California \"to accommodate streamlined, rapid production of Photons.\"</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5260b8e6ff30001d4e7209?format=jpeg\" alt=\"photon spacecraft capstone nasa moon illustration rocket lab rocketlab 00002\" height=\"1762\" width=\"2355\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An illustration of Rocket Lab&#39;s Photon spacecraft carrying NASA&#39;s CAPSTONE mission. The $23.6 effort is slated to launch in 2021.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.rocketlabusa.com/news/updates/link-to-rocket-lab-imagery-and-video/\" target=\"_blank\">Rocket Lab</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>\"It's such a powerful platform for people to experiment with and then utilize at its full force,\" Beck previously <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/rocket-lab-ceo-peter-beck-electron-failure-photon-lunar-spacecraft-2020-7\">told Business Insider</a>. \"You don't need to build a launcher. You don't need to build a spacecraft. In fact, you don't even need to develop your sensor — you can just give us a spec [specification] and we'll do the whole thing. It's a very different approach to the current state-of-the-art.\"</p><p><em>Dave Mosher contributed reporting.</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/rocket-lab-launches-photon-satellite-2020-9'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/clusterstock/~4/MOB6pifg65s\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 05 Sep 2020 00:11:32 +0000","feedId":13983,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f5260b8e6ff30001d4e7209?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"6f23e632d6fb00bbfd87f81b554e8bb4","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn54@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-07-534_59618ad0b12eeca4.webp","destWidth":2355,"destHeight":1762,"sourceBytes":182934,"destBytes":182934,"author":"mmcfalljohnsen@businessinsider.com (Morgan McFall-Johnsen)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f10a573f34d05715554a784?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn96@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-23-807_fd19190f01f8abee.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f52777ce6ff30001d4e72e4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn61@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-20-305_dfe40409fa498a5c.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f1097f2aee6a848cf58c878?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn29@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-14-061_05e8c9167f5d05ed.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f5260b8e6ff30001d4e7209?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn54@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-07-534_59618ad0b12eeca4.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn60@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-18-751_00f09200df8426be.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=MOB6pifg65s:AGNUTLY6UgQ:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn15@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-22-305_75b3bd12a178199b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=MOB6pifg65s:AGNUTLY6UgQ:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn12@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-20-010_0b7344cf39301ef2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=MOB6pifg65s:AGNUTLY6UgQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn19@2020_6/2020/09/05/09-01-16-382_aa03dbd78a72691a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn54@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-18-350_767e235117808cfa.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn12@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-17-769_edf0fa9b5dde1c97.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/clusterstock/~4/MOB6pifg65s":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn7@2020_6/2020/09/05/09-01-23-759_4e1f24368475d8c8.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599296467312},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","title":"A look at Robert Redfield's history and experience, the former Army physician and researcher leading the CDC under Trump","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/who-is-robert-redfield-cdc-director-trump-administration-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f529f827ed0ee001e25da7b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Robert Redfield\" height=\"3023\" width=\"6048\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Robert Redfield, director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), wears a protective mask during a House Select Subcommittee on the Coronavirus Crisis hearing on July 31, 2020 in Washington, DC.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Erin Scott-Pool/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Dr. Robert Redfield has been the director of the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention since March 2018.</li>\n<li>Earlier this week, Redfield asked governors to prepare <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cdc-tells-states-ready-for-vaccine-two-days-before-election-2020-9\">state distribution facilities for coronavirus vaccines by November 1</a>&#8212; two days before the presidential election.</li>\n<li>His appointment was met with mixed reviews: Dr. Anthony Fauci once described Redfield as \"a talented and committed physician/scientist.\" Redfield has also faced controversy over the misrepresentation of data for a clinical trial for an AIDS vaccine during his role as one of the leading AIDS researchers at the US Army.</li>\n<li>In August, he walked back from <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cdc-modified-covid-19-testing-guidelines-to-exclude-asymptomatic-people-2020-8\">CDC's modification of testing guidelines</a> to no longer encourage asymptomatic people to get tested to clarify everybody who wants a test can get one after drawing much criticism from public health and medical experts.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Earlier this week, US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention director Dr. Robert Redfield asked governors to prepare <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cdc-tells-states-ready-for-vaccine-two-days-before-election-2020-9\">state distribution facilities for coronavirus vaccines by November 1.</a></p><p>This news came as President Donald Trump is seeking to accelerate vaccine distribution through a program known as Operation Warp Speed, which some <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/operation-warp-speed-coronavirus-vaccine-moncef-slaoui-2020-8\">vaccine experts have scrutinized</a> over concerns of rushing clinical trials for safety. Lawmakers and watchdog groups have also pointed to the lack of transparency of selection of candidate vaccines, worrying that <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/operation-warp-speed-heres-how-covid-19-vaccines-were-selected-2020-8\">public trust in the vaccines could be hurt as a result.</a></p><p>It was the latest in a series of moves that spark controversy, as many Trump administration actions do.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.cdc.gov/about/leadership/director.htm\">Redfield</a>, 69, has led the CDC throughout the coronavirus pandemic. He received his medical degree from Georgetown University before conducting his residency at the Walter Reed Army Medical Center as a US Army officer.</p><p>Both <a href=\"https://www.cdcfoundation.org/conversations/robert-redfield\">his parents were scientists</a> at the National Institutes of Health. His wife, Joyce Hoke, is a nurse and two of their six children are doctors, according to <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2018/03/21/health/cdc-robert-redfield-aids.html\">The New York Times</a>.</p><p>The Trump administration <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/r-longtime-us-aids-researcher-picked-to-run-cdc-2018-3\">tapped him as the new director in March 2018,</a> after <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cdc-director-dr-brenda-fitzgerald-resigns-2018-1\">Brenda Fitzgerald resigned</a> over a report that said she purchased stock in Japan Tobacco during her time as CDC director.</p><p>Before starting his position as the director of the CDC, Redfield was a professor at the University of Maryland School of Medicine and was once one of the US Army's leading AIDS researchers.</p><p>Dr. Anthony Fauci once described Redfield as \"a talented and committed physician/scientist who has steadfastly devoted the past three decades to the study and care of HIV-infected individuals,\" <a href=\"https://www.theatlantic.com/science/archive/2018/03/trumps-pick-for-cdc-director-is-experienced-but-controversial/556202/\">The Atlantic reported.</a></p><h2>Former colleagues have alleged research issues, and the US Army investigated his work in 1993</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f52af44e6ff30001d4e743b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Robert Redfield\" height=\"1333\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Dr. Robert Redfield testifies about coronavirus preparedness and response to the House Government Oversight and Reform Committee on Capitol Hill on March 12, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">REUTERS/Joshua Roberts</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>But picking Redfield resurfaced questionable <a href=\"https://www.cdc.gov/about/leadership/director.htm\">records from Redfield's extensive work in HIV research.</a></p><p>In 1993, the US Army investigated whether Redfield misrepresented data in a clinical trial for an AIDS vaccine at Walter Reed, <a href=\"https://time.com/5211143/robert-redfield-cdc-director/\">Time magazine reported.</a> Ultimately, the Army acknowledged accuracy issues in the clinical trials spearheaded by Redfield but did not rule the errors as scientific misconduct, <a href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2018/03/21/595812200/research-misconduct-allegations-shadow-new-cdc-director\">NPR reported</a>.</p><p>Redfield left Walter Reed in 1994 to treat patients at an Army hospital in Washington, DC, in the wake of the controversy, <a href=\"https://www.courant.com/news/connecticut/hc-xpm-1994-06-30-9406300185-story.html\">The Hartford Courant reported</a>.</p><p>But skepticism remained years after the decision. Former Air Force Lt. Col. Craig Hendrix <a href=\"https://khn.org/news/research-misconduct-allegations-shadow-likely-cdc-appointee/\">told Kaiser Health News</a> in March 2018 that \"Either he was egregiously sloppy with data or it was fabricated.\"</p><p><a href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/04/politics/cdc-redfield-aids-walter-reed-army-investigation/index.html\">CNN reported</a> that interviews with former colleagues and a review of internal documents \"suggest Redfield knew he was misrepresenting the data behind the vaccine, even as he publicly touted its results — an effort that ultimately helped garner millions in federal funds for further testing.\"</p><p>Democratic Sen. Patty Murray <a href=\"https://www.help.senate.gov/imo/media/doc/031918%20-%20Pres.%20Trump%20-%20CDC%20Candidate%20Redfield.pdf\">wrote a letter </a>to the president that she was concerned with Redfield leading the CDC, \"given his lack of public health credentials and his history of controversial positions regarding the prevention and treatment of HIV/AIDS.\"</p><p>Additionally, Redfield had no experience leading a public health agency in the past, <a href=\"https://www.vox.com/2018/3/22/17150322/robert-redfield-cdc-director-trump\">Vox pointed out.</a></p><p>But the CDC director doesn't require Senate confirmation, so Redfield assumed the role on March 26, 2018.</p><h2>Leading the CDC through the coronavirus pandemic</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f529f4d7ed0ee001e25da7a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Trump, Redfield\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Centers for Disease Control (CDC) Director Robert Redfield passes U.S. President Donald Trump as he approaches the podium to address the daily coronavirus task force briefing at the White House in Washington, U.S., April 22, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">REUTERS/Jonathan Ernst</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>During the coronavirus pandemic, Redfield has overseen one of the most important government agencies for compiling and disseminating accurate public health information about a brand-new disease. He's <a href=\"https://www.cdc.gov/washington/testimony.html\">testified before Congress</a>, <a href=\"https://www.today.com/video/cdc-director-states-reopening-will-be-step-by-step-prudent-process-82196549715\">given interviews</a>, and generally been more visible than a CDC director usually is.</p><p>In August, he was met swift backlash when the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cdc-modified-covid-19-testing-guidelines-to-exclude-asymptomatic-people-2020-8\">CDC modified testing guidelines</a> to no longer encourage asymptomatic people to get tested, which The New York Times reported came <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-officials-reportedly-pressured-cdc-on-coronavirus-testing-2020-8\">from pressures from top</a> Trump administration officials to narrow testing recommendations.</p><p>Fauci <a href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/26/politics/fauci-coronavirus-cdc-testing/index.html\">told CNN</a> that he was not part of the discussion on changes to testing guidelines because he was undergoing surgery. Former CDC director Dr. Tom Frieden said the top-down mandates&#160; <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/former-cdc-director-move-to-end-asymptomatic-testing-unscientific-2020-8\">\"are frankly not scientifically supportable\"</a> and that it's \"problematic because it undermines our trust in government.\"<br><br>After much criticism from scientists and public health experts, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cdc-director-says-anyone-wants-covid-test-get-one-2020-8\">Redfield walked back the changes to the testing guidelines</a> and clarified that everybody who wants a test can get one, although he added that \"everyone who <em>wants</em>&#160;a test does not necessarily&#160;<em>need</em> a test.\"</p><p>Earlier on in the pandemic, Redfield clashed a few times with Trump. In March, when House lawmakers asked him whether a physical wall along the US border with Mexico would prevent the spread of the virus, he answered, \"Not that I've seen,\" <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/coronavirus-trump-border-wall-cdc-director-robert-redfield-contradict-2020-3\">contradicting Trump's claim</a> that \"we need the border more than ever.\"</p><p>In April, shortly after Trump announced he would <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-cutting-who-funding-amid-coronavirus-could-cost-american-lives-2020-4\">cut funding to the World Health Organization</a>, Redfield said in an interview that the CDC and WHO have a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cdc-says-will-keep-working-who-despite-trump-halting-funds-2020-4\">\"long history of working together\"</a> and added, \"I'd like to do the postmortem on this outbreak once we get through it together.\"</p><p>In July, the CDC ultimately backtracked from its original restrictive guidelines on reopening schools, which <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-defies-cdc-director-threatens-cuts-states-with-closed-schools-2020-7\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-defies-cdc-director-threatens-cuts-states-with-closed-schools-2020-7\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">Trump slammed on Twitter</a> as \"very tough and expensive,\"&#160; to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cdc-issues-new-guidance-opening-schools-after-criticism-from-trump-2020-7\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cdc-issues-new-guidance-opening-schools-after-criticism-from-trump-2020-7\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">fully support the reopening of schools</a>. \"Reopening schools creates opportunity to invest in the education, well-being, and future of one of America's greatest assets — our children,\" the CDC said.</p><p>In an <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/outlook/2020/07/14/cdc-directors-trump-politics/\">opinion piece for the Washington Post</a> in mid-July, four former directors of the CDC wrote that Trump has politicized the agency's science in a dangerous way.</p><p>\"One of the many contributions the CDC provides our country is sound public health guidance that states and communities can adapt to their local context — expertise even more essential during a pandemic, when uncertainty is the norm,\" the former directors wrote. \"The four of us led the CDC over a period of more than 15 years, spanning Republican and Democratic administrations alike. We cannot recall over our collective tenure a single time when political pressure led to a change in the interpretation of scientific evidence.\"</p><ul class=\"read-more-links\"><li>Read more:</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cdc-director-says-anyone-wants-covid-test-get-one-2020-8\" data-read-more-link=\"\" data-e2e-name=\"read-more-link\">CDC director now says anyone who wants a COVID-19 test can get one following backlash over changes to testing guidelines that excluded asymptomatic people</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cdc-director-robert-redfield-deadly-coronavirus-surge-fall-winter-2020-7\" data-read-more-link=\"\" data-e2e-name=\"read-more-link\">CDC director predicts this fall and winter will be 'one of the most difficult times we've experienced in American public health'</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cdc-robert-redfield-us-ready-to-reopen-prepare-flu-season-2020-5\" data-read-more-link=\"\" data-e2e-name=\"read-more-link\">CDC director says US is ready to begin reopening but warns that it needs to have enhanced contact tracing and rapid testing in place before flu season</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/former-cdc-director-move-to-end-asymptomatic-testing-unscientific-2020-8\" data-read-more-link=\"\" data-e2e-name=\"read-more-link\">Former CDC director: The agency's unscientific moves to end asymptomatic testing are 'undermining trust in government' and risking people's lives</a></li></ul><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a rel=\"noopener\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d717d762e22af7862365c65?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NFL How to stream games online 4x3\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" Terrill/AP Photo; Mark LoMoglio/AP Photo; Alyssa Powell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>The American TV audience <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nfl-ratings-most-watched-sports-events-2018-2019-1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">watches more NFL Football than any other sport</a>, so I probably don't have to remind you that the 2020-21 season starts September 10.</strong></li><li><strong>However, it's still not that easy to figure out how to watch your favorite teams without a cable subscription. </strong></li><li><strong>Broadcast rights continue to be spread across several networks, with a few games per week shown exclusively on different channels, including ESPN, NBC, Fox, CBS, and the NFL Network.</strong></li><li>HD antennas and streaming services, like <strong><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&mid=42392&u1=biip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hulu.com%2Flive-tvom%2Flive-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Hulu + Live TV</a>, <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.sling.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Sling TV</a>, <a href=\"http://www.fubo.tv/welcome?irad=343747&irmp=196318&subId1=biip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.fubo.tv%2Fwelcometv%2Fwelcome\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">FuboTV</a>, <a href=\"https://tv.youtube.com/welcome/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">YouTube TV</a>, <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/l/16256994011?ref_=assoc_tag_ph_1501285904297&_encoding=UTF8&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=pf4&tag=biip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football-20&linkId=4a8bbbba81cb420528b28bd963f8fca681cb420528b28bd963f8fca6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Amazon Prime Video</a>, and <a href=\"https://nflst.directv.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">NFL Sunday Ticket</a>, all offer select NFL games without the need for a cable subscription.</strong></li><li>If price is no concern, we recommend a combination of either <a href=\"http://www.fubo.tv/welcome?irad=343747&irmp=196318&subId1=biip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.fubo.tv%2Fwelcometv%2Fwelcome\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Fubo TV</a> or <a href=\"https://tv.youtube.com/welcome/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">YouTube TV</a> with the NFL RedZone add-on, and a separate <a href=\"https://nflst.directv.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">NFL Sunday Ticket subscription</a> in order to stream the most games all season long.</li></ul><p>Whether you're interested in watching Tom Brady whip the pigskin in his new Florida digs, checking out how professional football looks in Las Vegas, or you happen to be a fool like me still holding out hopes that the Detroit Lions can win a Super Bowl (cue the uproarious and hurtful laughter), you can use at least one of the methods outlined below to watch the 2020 NFL season.</p><p>With that said, the right NFL streaming option for you will vary depending on your fandom priorities. Basically, the games are spread across five primary networks: ESPN, NBC, Fox, CBS, and the NFL Network. Your location also determines which games get aired on your local stations.</p><p>To help ensure you get access to all the games you'd like to watch, we've broken down the ins and outs of watching the NFL without a cable subscription.</p><h2>How to watch live NFL games without cable</h2><p>The 2020 NFL season will kick off on September 10 with a Thursday night game between the Houston Texans and Kansas City Chiefs on NBC.</p><p>Following the opener, Sunday afternoon games with an NFC home team will be aired on Fox, and Sunday afternoon games with an AFC home team will be shown on CBS. Meanwhile, Sunday Night Football airs on NBC, and regular Thursday Night Football is broadcast on NFL Network all season long. Thursday Night Football will also be shown on Fox and streamed via <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/l/16256994011?ref_=assoc_tag_ph_1501285904297&_encoding=UTF8&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=pf4&tag=biip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football-20&linkId=4a8bbbba81cb420528b28bd963f8fca681cb420528b28bd963f8fca6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Amazon Prime</a> or Twitch starting week five through the end of the season. Finally, Monday Night Football is on ESPN.&#160;</p><p>You can access many of these channels without a cable subscription via several streaming services, like <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&mid=42392&u1=biip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hulu.com%2Flive-tvom%2Flive-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Hulu + Live TV</a>, <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.sling.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Sling TV</a>, <a href=\"http://www.fubo.tv/welcome?irad=343747&irmp=196318&subId1=biip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.fubo.tv%2Fwelcometv%2Fwelcome\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">FuboTV</a>, <a href=\"https://tv.youtube.com/welcome/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">YouTube TV</a>, and <a href=\"https://nflst.directv.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">NFL Sunday Ticket</a>. Additionally, some services offer NFL RedZone as an add-on for fans who want to watch all the best action from across the league simultaneously rather than sit through one game. If you want to watch games on your local stations without cable, you can also opt for an <a href=\"http://bestbuy.7tiv.net/c/196318/614286/10014?subId1=biip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fsite%2Fdynex-indoor-loop-hdtv-antenna-black%2F6348595.p%3FskuId%3D63485958595\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">HDTV antenna</a>.</p><p>Depending on the service, you can stream through <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-4k-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">smart TVs</a>, <a href=\"https://bestbuy.7tiv.net/c/196318/614286/10014?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fsite%2Fsony-playstation-4-1tb-console-black%2F5850905.p%3FskuId%3D5850905\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">game consoles</a>, and streaming devices, like <a href=\"http://bestbuy.7tiv.net/c/196318/614286/10014?subId1=biip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fsite%2Fapple-apple-tv-4k-32gb-latest-model-black%2F5901530.p%3FskuId%3D59015301530\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Apple TV</a>, <a href=\"https://bestbuy.7tiv.net/c/196318/614286/10014?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fsite%2Froku-streaming-stick-4k-streaming-media-player-with-voice-remote-with-tv-controls-black%2F5948005.p%3FskuId%3D5948005\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Roku</a>, and <a href=\"http://bestbuy.7tiv.net/c/196318/614286/10014?subId1=biip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fsite%2Famazon-fire-tv-stick-4k-with-all-new-alexa-voice-remote-streaming-media-player-black%2F6301667.p%3FskuId%3D63016671667\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Amazon Fire TV</a>. Some platforms can also be streamed on-the-go via smartphones, laptops, and tablets.&#160;</p><h3>Here's how you can stream all the NFL content you want without signing up for a traditional cable subscription.</h3>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tHDTV Antenna\n\t\n\t<p>You can purchase an antenna, like this <a href=\"http://bestbuy.7tiv.net/c/196318/614286/10014?subId1=biip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fsite%2Fdynex-indoor-loop-hdtv-antenna-black%2F6348595.p%3FskuId%3D6348595\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Dynex model</a>, to add to your TV for under $10, giving you access to local channels within a certain distance.&#160;</p><h3><strong>What you get:</strong></h3><p>Hooking up an HD antenna to your TV gives you access to local over-the-air (OTA) signals in your location. This means that you will be able to access the local affiliates of major broadcast networks, like Fox, CBS, and NBC.</p><p>This lets you watch all the regional games broadcast from wherever you're located. You also get the Sunday Night Football matchup that airs on NBC. Because it's only a one-time payment, this is a great option if you're solely interested in watching the team in your area. However, you will not get access to any out-of-market games or games that air on ESPN or the NFL Network.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5f512a71733ace27cc14e2c2\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5f512a71733ace27cc14e2c2&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div>\n\tSling TV\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5270947ed0ee001e25d92f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How Much is Sling TV 4x3\" height=\"1800\" width=\"2400\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alyssa Powell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>If you're looking for a live TV streaming service to watch football, <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.sling.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Sling TV</a> is a great budget option that gives you most of the channels you need at a cheaper price than <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=42392&#38;u1=biip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hulu.com%2Flive-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Hulu</a> or <a href=\"http://www.fubo.tv/welcome?irad=343747&#38;irmp=196318&#38;subId1=biip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.fubo.tv%2Fwelcome\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">FuboTV</a>. There are three different plans, depending on what channels you prioritize. Sling Orange and Sling Blue each cost $30 per month, while the combined Sling Orange + Blue plan costs $45 per month.</p><h3>What you get:</h3><p>Sling Orange has ESPN, while Sling Blue has Fox and NBC in select markets. CBS is not currently offered by Sling. While there is a Sports Extra package, it does not include any channels that air live NFL games.&#160;</p><p>Your best bet to get access to the most NFL games via Sling is to sign up for the <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.sling.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Sling Orange + Blue plan</a> and cash in on Sling's current promotional offer of a <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.sling.com/deals?footer\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">free antenna</a> for local channels. The free antenna requires that you prepay for two months of the Sling service.</p><p>If you don't want it all, you can just sign up for Sling Blue to gain access to Sunday afternoon games on Fox and Sunday Night Football games on NBC, or just Sling Orange to gain access to Monday Night games on ESPN, in addition to the local offerings included with the antenna. As with all streaming services, game availability is subject to <a href=\"https://www.fcc.gov/consumers/guides/sports-blackouts\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">blackouts</a>.</p><p>With Sling's channel listings and the fact that they provide a free antenna, you can gain access to all local channels and ESPN, making it one of the most cost-effective ways to tune in to the NFL. However, there is not currently a way to add NFL Redzone or the NFL Network to your Sling TV package.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5da63b964af909432430f8b2\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5da63b964af909432430f8b2&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div>\n\tHulu with Live TV\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5270f9e6ff30001d4e72a6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Hulu Basic vs Hulu Premium 4x3\" height=\"1800\" width=\"2400\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>In addition to all of its other offerings, <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=42392&#38;u1=biip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hulu.com%2Flive-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Hulu + Live TV</a> has nearly everything you need to stream NFL games for $54.99 per month. However, like Sling TV, there's no option to add the NFL Network or NFL RedZone as a channel, which could be a deal-breaker if you're hoping to watch and monitor action across the league.</p><h3>What you get:&#160;</h3><p>Like an HD antenna, <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=42392&#38;u1=biip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hulu.com%2Flive-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Hulu + Live TV</a> gets you access to all the local affiliates of the major broadcasts, meaning Fox, CBS, and NBC. These will show the games that are within your regional broadcast map with the exception of any <a href=\"https://www.fcc.gov/consumers/guides/sports-blackouts\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">blackouts</a>. In addition, you also get ESPN, which gives you access to all Monday Night Football games, and some of the best NFL coverage and analysis on TV.&#160;</p><p>While you don't get access to watch out-of-network games from across the country like you do with NFL RedZone or NFL Sunday Ticket, this is a comprehensive way to tune into most locally and nationally televised games. Hulu does not offer a way to watch the first three regular Thursday Night Football games, however, since those will be aired on NFL Network.&#160;</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5e18fba0b2e66a3b703df013\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e18fba0b2e66a3b703df013&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div>\n\tFuboTV\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5271187ed0ee001e25d933?format=jpeg\" alt=\"FuboTV\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">FuboTV</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>At $64.99 per month for the Family Plan, <a href=\"http://www.fubo.tv/welcome?irad=343747&#38;irmp=196318&#38;subId1=biip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.fubo.tv%2Fwelcome\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">FuboTV</a> is one of the most comprehensive yet expensive live streaming options for NFL football. You can also spend an extra $10.99 per month to add the Sports Plus with NFL RedZone package or sign up for the Ultra Plan, which includes NFL Redzone and several other extra channels, for $84.99 per month.</p><h3>What you get:</h3><p>In terms of NFL games, the Family Plan includes access to local CBS, NBC, and Fox stations (<a href=\"https://support.fubo.tv/hc/en-us/articles/360015622031-What-NFL-games-can-I-watch-on-fuboTV-this-week-\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">regional availability and blackout restrictions apply</a>). FuboTV's Family Plan also grants you access to ESPN to watch Monday Night Football, and NFL Network to stream Thursday Night Football all season long.&#160;</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5e1f7fd324306a1d0b4da52b\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e1f7fd324306a1d0b4da52b&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div>\n\tYouTube TV\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5271c4e6ff30001d4e72ac?format=jpeg\" alt=\"YouTubeTV NFL Network\" height=\"1200\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">YouTube</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>With a base price of $64.99 per month, YouTube TV is another service that offers access to most NFL games. Additionally, the service <a href=\"https://nflcommunications.com/Pages/NFL-Network-and-YouTubeTV-Reach-New-Carriage-Agreement.aspx\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">just announced</a> an agreement with the NFL to offer NFL Redzone as an add-on included in their Sports Plus package for an additional $10.99 per month.&#160;</p><h3>What you get:</h3><p>Like other services at this price range, YouTube TV offers access to all the local channels you need to watch NFL games, including CBS, Fox, and NBC. YouTube TV also offers ESPN and NFL Network in their base package, so you'll be able to watch all Monday Night Football and Thursday Night Football games. And with the news of the new Sports Plus package, you can also watch NFL Redzone for an additional $10.99 per month.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5e1f7e01b6d52d1b7108fd25\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e1f7e01b6d52d1b7108fd25&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div>\n\tNFL Sunday Ticket\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ec69f755af6cc4bd1301f04?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NFL logo\" height=\"1885\" width=\"2514\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">REUTERS/Carlo Allegri</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>NFL Sunday Ticket used to only be available with a cable subscription, but NFL fans in non-DirecTV markets anywhere in the country can now gain access to every Sunday afternoon game.</p><p>There are two separate plans available: The <a href=\"https://nflst.directv.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">NFL Sunday Ticket To Go plan costs $73.49 per month</a> for four months, which is $293.96 total. There is also the <a href=\"https://nflst.directv.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">NFL Sunday Ticket Max plan for $99 per month</a> for four months, adding up to $396 total.</p><h3>What you get:</h3><p>Both plans give you access to all out-of-market Sunday afternoon games. This means that you do not get access to Thursday, Sunday, or Monday night games. You also won't be able to stream locally televised games with only an NFL Sunday Ticket subscription. However, this is the only way for people hoping to watch full live games of their favorite teams out of market. A fun feature included in both plans is that you can watch four games at once on your screen.</p><p>In addition to the normal features, NFL Sunday Ticket Max adds in NFL RedZone and the DirecTV Fantasy Zone, which is a new channel solely dedicated watching games through the lens of fantasy football.&#160;</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5f5134c2724609260a1fdab6\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5f5134c2724609260a1fdab6&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div>\n\tAmazon Prime Video\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f52747b7ed0ee001e25d95c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amazon NFL football\" height=\"650\" width=\"870\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Though yon won't get local channels, NFL Network, or in-depth analysis, Amazon Prime Video members can watch select Thursday Night Football games with their subscription for no additional cost. A standalone Amazon Prime Video membership costs $8.99 a month, and the service is included as part of an <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/l/16256994011?ref_=assoc_tag_ph_1501285904297&#38;_encoding=UTF8&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=pf4&#38;tag=biip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football-20&#38;linkId=4a8bbbba81cb420528b28bd963f8fca6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Amazon Prime</a> subscription for $119 per year.</p><h3>What you get:</h3><p>Amazon Prime Video will stream 11 Thursday Night Football games staring the week of October 8. These game will also be broadcast on NFL Network and Fox. Since Amazon won't be streaming any additional games, Prime Video on its own is really only suitable for very casual football fans who just want to stream a few games this season.&#160;</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5e28784d24306a101e35ab35\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e28784d24306a101e35ab35&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" Insider Reviews' deals page for more sales</a>.</li></ul><p>To ring in Labor Day 2020, Casper is offering 15% off mattresses and 10% off everything else sitewide.&#160;<br><br>Casper revamped its line of mattresses earlier this year and we spent the entire spring and summer testing them out. Here's <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/casper-mattress-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">a guide on what to expect with each one</a>, but TL;DR — most people will do well with the <a href=\"https://casper.5ad6.net/c/196318/396851/7235?u=https%3A%2F%2Fcasper.com%2Fmattresses%2Fcasper-original%2F&subid2=1599250433178a8bhl9s9e&subId3=xid:fr1599250437726edg37726edg\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\" data-orig-url=\"https://casper.5ad6.net/c/196318/396851/7235?u=https%3A%2F%2Fcasper.com%2Fmattresses%2Fcasper-original%2F&subid2=1599250433178a8bhl9s9e9s9e\" data-ml-id=\"15\" data-ml=\"true\" data-xid=\"fr1599250437726edg\" data-uri=\"124a9a764f5a99ad0badcd4859ad97b3\">Casper Original</a>&#160;because of its average firmness, accessible price, and excellent motion isolation.</p><p>Casper often has sales with discounts of at least 10%, so if the current sale has expired, just wait until the next one before ordering. We'll keep this post updated with the latest sale information too.</p><p><a href=\"https://casper.5ad6.net/c/196318/396851/7235?u=https%3A%2F%2Fcasper.com%2Fhome-2020%2F\" target=\"_blank\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/clusterstock/~4/OuyUjs7vq80\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 20:23:00 +0000","feedId":13983,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5ef4cec5988ee3172278ad3a?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"3cb604633e6ae33ec36d2df9e52bbe07","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn50@2020_2/2020/09/05/09-01-07-467_e9dbb49bf77b384b.webp","destWidth":800,"destHeight":600,"sourceBytes":21922,"destBytes":21922,"author":"tbufete@businessinsider.com (Tercius Bufete,Sarah Saril)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5ef4cec5988ee3172278ad3a?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn50@2020_2/2020/09/05/09-01-07-467_e9dbb49bf77b384b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ec41cadf0f4195bc6006108?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn7@2020_2/2020/09/05/09-01-23-039_270201594562dc0a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn60@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-18-751_00f09200df8426be.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=OuyUjs7vq80:pR0HobXS8A0:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn86@2020_2/2020/09/05/09-01-16-212_3227a8560971ec97.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=OuyUjs7vq80:pR0HobXS8A0:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn45@2020_5/2020/09/05/09-01-24-259_12d80178f92eda34.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=OuyUjs7vq80:pR0HobXS8A0:gIN9vFwOqvQ":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn54@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-18-350_767e235117808cfa.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn12@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-17-769_edf0fa9b5dde1c97.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/clusterstock/~4/OuyUjs7vq80":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn99@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-22-829_b21c98810c7c95d0.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599296467315},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","title":"Now-Republican incumbent Jeff Van Drew and Amy Kennedy vie for a chance to represent New Jersey's 2nd Congressional District","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/new-jersey-2nd-district-house-election-jeff-van-drew-amy-kennedy-2020","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f3ac59bea6ce0002839ac78?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amy Kennedy speaking\" height=\"2560\" width=\"5120\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Amy Kennedy speaks at the Many Faces Of Mental Health Gala in 2016\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jemal Countess/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>First-term Rep. Jeff Van Drew will face Democrat Amy Kennedy in New Jersey's 2nd Congressional District.</li>\n<li>After one year as a Democratic representative, Van Drew switched parties and now is a member of the Republican Party.</li>\n<li>New Jersey's 2nd congressional district is the southermost and largest Congressional District in New Jersey. It contains all of Cumberland, Salem, Atlantic and Cape May counties.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>&#160;</p><p>First-term<strong> Rep. Jeff Van Drew</strong> squares off against Democrat <strong>Amy Kennedy</strong> in November to represent New Jersey's 2nd congressional district in the U.S. House of Representatives.</p><h2>The candidates</h2><p>Before his foray into national politics, Van Drew was a dentist for 30 years and served both in local elected office on the Cape May County Board of Chosen Freeholders and in the New Jersey state legislature, serving as a member of the General Assembly from 2002 to 2008 and in the State Senate from 2008 to 2018.</p><p>In 2018, Van Drew defeated Republican Seth Grossman by 7.7 percent. He switched his party ties from Democrat to Republican just one day after voting against the impeachment of President Donald Trump in December 2019.</p><p>\"This is who I am, it's who I always was, but there was more tolerance of moderate Democrats, of Blue Dog Democrats, of conservative Democrats,\" <a href=\"https://apnews.com/9c058c6123efdc75bc3919936309e6b5\">Van Drew said</a>, \"and I think that's going away.\"</p><p>Kennedy, Van Drew's challenger, is the current president of The Kennedy Forum, a behavioral and mental health non-profit. Kennedy is also a board member of Mental Health America. She is the wife of Patrick J. Kennedy, a nephew of former U.S. President John F. Kennedy and former longtime Democratic congressman from Rhode Island. Her <a href=\"https://www.amykennedyforcongress.com/issues/\">campaign platform is centered on</a> strengthening the Affordable Care Act, affordable college educations, and protecting workers' rights.</p><h2>The district</h2><p>New Jersey's 2nd congressional district is the state's most <a href=\"https://cdn.ballotpedia.org/images/d/d1/New_Jersey_December_2011_Redistricting_Map.png\">southern and largest district</a>. It is home to all of Cumberland, Salem, Atlantic and Cape May counties as well as portions of Camden, Burlington, Ocean, and Gloucester counties.</p><p>The district flipped from backing former President Barack Obama by eight percentage points over GOP nominee Mitt Romney in 2012 to voting for President Donald Trump by over four points, 50.6% to 45%, over Democrat Hillary Clinton in 2016, <a href=\"https://www.dailykos.com/stories/2012/11/19/1163009/-Daily-Kos-Elections-presidential-results-by-congressional-district-for-the-2012-2008-elections\">according to the Daily Kos.&#160;</a></p><h2>The money race</h2><p>According to the <a href=\"https://www.opensecrets.org/races/summary?cycle=2020&id=NJ02&spec=Np;spec=N\">Center for Responsive Politics</a>, Van Drew has raised $2.5 million – $1 million more than Kennedy. Van Drew also has $1.2 million in cash on hand, also nearly a million more than Kennedy who has only $137,000 remaining.&#160;</p><p>Before switching political parties, Van Drew notably did not fundraise in the first quarter of 2019.</p><p>\"I thought it was a tiny bit distasteful in the very first weeks and months of my election being in there, that the very first thing I was doing was raising money again,\" Van Drew said to the <a href=\"https://newjerseyglobe.com/congress/van-drew-says-he-didnt-fundraise-in-first-quarter/\">New Jersey Globe</a>. \"We were in the middle of a closure, a government shutdown. I had real issues with my Coast Guard and with the FAA.\"</p><h2>What experts say</h2><p>The race between Van Drew and Kennedy is rated as a \"toss-up\" by <a href=\"https://insideelections.com/ratings/house\">Inside Elections</a> and <a href=\"https://cookpolitical.com/ratings/house-race-ratings\">The Cook Political Report</a>, and \"leans Republican\" by <a href=\"http://centerforpolitics.org/crystalball/2020-house/\">Sabato's Crystal Ball at the University of Virginia Center for Politics</a>.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article up to the election is that there will no \"peaceful transition of power in 2020.\"</p><p>\"So Donald Trump will do anything and everything within which to win. And I believe that includes manipulating the ballots,\" Cohen said, <a href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/michael-cohen-says-trump-will-do-anything-stay-office-even-n1239374\">according to NBC.</a></p><p>\"I believe that he would even go so far as to start a war in order to prevent himself from being removed from office,\" Cohen added. \"My biggest fear is that there will not be a peaceful transition of power in 2020.\"</p><p>Cohen's comments come ahead of the release of his new book next week called \"Disloyal, a Memoir: The True Story of the Former Personal Attorney to President Donald J. Trump.\"</p><p>The 54-year-old, who was Trump's personal lawyer from 2006 to 2018, began a three-year prison sentence last year for financial crimes and lying to Congress. He was released in July because of coronavirus concerns and is spending the rest of his sentence at home.</p><p>The White House has called Cohen's memoir \"fan fiction\" in a statement, adding that he 17:01:07","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","title":"Eight-term incumbent Rep. Michael McCaul will face Democrat Mike Siegel in Texas' 10th Congressional District","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/texas-10th-district-house-election-michael-mccaul-mike-siegel-2020","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f3eb75742f43f001ddfe15d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"michael mccaul\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Rep. Michael McCaul, R-Texas, talks with reporters after a meeting with President-elect Donald Trump at Trump Tower, Tuesday, Nov. 29, 2016, in New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Associated Press/Evan Vucci</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Rep. Michael McCaul will face Democrat Mike Siegel in Texas' 10th congressional district.</li>\n<li>The district is located in southeast Texas and contains portions of the Greater Houston and Greater Austin areas.</li>\n<li>McCaul has raised $2.46 million &#8211; about $1.5 million more than his Democratic opponent, Siegel, in this race so far.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>&#160;</p><p>Eight-term incumbent <strong>Rep. Michael McCaul</strong> is facing a re-match against Democratic challenger <strong>Mike Siegel</strong> in Texas' 10th Congressional District.</p><h2>The candidates</h2><p>McCaul was first elected to his House seat in 2005. He previously served as the chief of counterterrorism and national security under the Texas branch of the U.S. Attorney's office.</p><p>As of 2018, McCaul was the <a href=\"https://www.rollcall.com/wealth-of-congress/\">fifth-wealthiest member</a> of the U.S. Congress. He is currently the <a href=\"https://mccaul.house.gov/about/committees-and-caucuses\">Republican leader</a> on the House Foreign Affairs Committee and is the chairman emeritus of the House Committee on Homeland Security.</p><p>Siegel, a former Teach for America corps member, previously worked as an Austin city attorney. His <a href=\"https://siegelfortexas.org/issues/\">campaign platform is centered</a> on implementing a universal healthcare system that covers all Americans, expanding labor rights, passing the Green New Deal to combat climate change, police reform, and assisting people with student debt.&#160;</p><p>In the 2018 midterm elections, McCaul defeated Siegel by 4.3 points, 51.1% to 46.8%</p><h2>The district</h2><p>Texas' 10th Congressional District is located in the state's southeastern region and is home to the northern portion of the Greater Houston area and a selection of the Greater Austin area. The district includes the suburbs of Katy, Cypress, Tomball, Pflugerville, Bastrop, and Elgin.&#160;</p><p>Before McCaul was elected in 2005, the district had not been represented by a Republican since Rep. Robert Hawley took office in 1897.&#160;</p><p>President Donald Trump carried the 10th District by nine points, 52% to 43%, in the 2016 election, <a href=\"https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1whYBonfwlgTGnYl7U_IH31G0JNYQ9QBIjDfqkZHkW-0/edit#gid=0\">according to the Daily Kos.</a> In 2018, when McCaul beat Siegel by four points, Democratic US Senate candidate Beto O'Rourke tied Republican Sen. Ted Cruz in that year's US Senate race, 49% to 49%.&#160;</p><h2>The money race</h2><p>According to the <a href=\"https://www.opensecrets.org/races/summary?cycle=2020&id=TX10&spec=Np;spec=N\">Center for Responsive Politics</a>, McCaul has raised $2.46 million – about $1.5 million more than his Democratic opponent, Siegel. With $165,000 remaining, Siegel has over seven times less cash on hand than McCaul with $1.32 million.</p><h2>What some of the experts say:</h2><p>The race between McCaul and Siegel is rated as \"likely Republican\" by <a href=\"https://insideelections.com/ratings/house\">Inside Elections</a> and \"leans Republican\" by <a href=\"https://cookpolitical.com/ratings/house-race-ratings\">The Cook Political Report</a> and <a href=\"http://centerforpolitics.org/crystalball/2020-house/\">Sabato's Crystal Ball at the University of Virginia Center for Politics</a>.</p><div Panetta)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f3eb75742f43f001ddfe15d?format=jpeg":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn60@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-18-751_00f09200df8426be.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=5VhOvpdbpcY:01rz45LeAV8:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn12@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-14-041_7470af87991ae1e8.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=5VhOvpdbpcY:01rz45LeAV8:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn100@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-18-436_cccff92a667322e6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=5VhOvpdbpcY:01rz45LeAV8:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn16@2020_2/2020/09/05/09-01-14-270_f06a87f7aec1de7c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn54@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-18-350_767e235117808cfa.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn12@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-17-769_edf0fa9b5dde1c97.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/clusterstock/~4/5VhOvpdbpcY":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn45@2020_6/2020/09/05/09-01-19-493_c65e2b5903f010d0.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599296467309},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","title":"First-term Rep. Tom Malinowski looks to defend his seat against Tom Kean, Jr. in New Jersey's 7th congressional district","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/new-jersey-7th-district-house-election-tom-malinowski-tom-kean-jr-2020","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f3bf226a3eafa001de06b82?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tom Malinowski\" height=\"1500\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Former U.S. Assistant Secretary of State for Democracy, Human Rights, and Labor Tom Malinowski delivers remarks about the release of the 2015 Human Rights Report at the State Department Harry S Truman building April 13, 2016 in Washington, DC. The State Department&#39;s report covers internationally recognized individual, civil, political and workers rights as practiced around the world according to the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and submits the annual report to Congress.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>First-term Rep. Tom Malinowski will face Tom Kean Jr. in New Jersey's 7th congressional district.</li>\n<li>The district is located in the northwestern region of the state and includes all of Hunterdon County and parts of Essex, Warren, Morris, Union, and Somerset counties.</li>\n<li>According to the Center for Responsive Politics, Malinowski has raised $4.2 million &#8211; double the amount of of Kean Jr.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>&#160;</p><p>First-term Democratic <strong>Rep. Tom Malinowski</strong> looks to defend his seat against <strong>Tom Kean Jr</strong>. in New Jersey's 7th congressional district.</p><h2>The candidates</h2><p>Malinowski, the incumbent, is a Polish immigrant and is the former assistant secretary of State for Democracy, Human Rights, and Labor under the Obama administration. Under the Clinton administration, Malinowski acted as the senior director of the National Security Council where he <a href=\"https://2009-2017.state.gov/r/pa/ei/biog/224368.htm\">oversaw foreign policy speechwriting</a> for President Bill Clinton.&#160;</p><p>Kean, Malinowski's Republican challenger, is the sitting minority leader in the New Jersey Senate – a position Kean has held since 2008. He was previously elected to the New Jersey Senate in 2003 and was previously a representative for the same district for two years before leaving to join the senate.&#160;</p><p>In 2013, New Jersey's Republican Gov. <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/chris-christie-tom-kean-o-toole-election-2016-steve-sweeney-2013-11\">Chris Christie attempted to oust Kean</a> from his senate minority leader position, but failed after fellow Republicans in the New Jersey Senate <a href=\"https://www.nj.com/politics/index.ssf/2013/11/despite_opposition_from_christie_tom_kean_jr_wins_fourth_term_as_state_senate_minority_leader.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"40\">re-elected Kean in a 10-6 vote</a>.</p><p>Malinowski ran unopposed in the district's Democratic primaries, while Kean handily defeated his two opponents after receiving 79 percent of the Republican primary vote.</p><h2>The district</h2><p>New Jersey's 7th congressional district is located in the northwestern region of the state. This suburban, relatively wealthy district includes all of Hunterdon County and parts of Essex, Warren, Morris, Union, and Somerset counties.</p><p>Unlike New Jersey's 2nd and 3rd Congressional Districts in the southern part of the state, two swingy Obama-Trump districts, New Jersey's 7th District is a Romney-Clinton district.</p><p>It flipped from voting for 2012 GOP nominee presidential nominee Mitt Romney by six points to voting for 2016 Democratic nominee Hillary Clinton by a margin of one percentage point, <a href=\"https://www.dailykos.com/stories/2012/11/19/1163009/-Daily-Kos-Elections-presidential-results-by-congressional-district-for-the-2012-2008-elections\">according to the Daily Kos.&#160;</a></p><h2>The money race</h2><p>According to the <a href=\"https://www.opensecrets.org/races/summary?cycle=2020&id=NJ07&spec=Np;spec=N\">Center for Responsive Politics</a>, Malinowski has raised $4.2 million – more than double than Kean with $2 million. Malinowski also has over twice the amount of cash on hand than his challenger. Kean has only $1.3 million remaining for his campaign compared to Malinowski's $3.3 million.</p><h2>What experts say</h2><p>The race between Malinowski and Kean is rated as \"leans Democratic\" by <a href=\"https://cookpolitical.com/ratings/house-race-ratings\">The Cook Political Report</a>, <a href=\"https://insideelections.com/ratings/house\">Inside Elections</a>, and <a href=\"http://centerforpolitics.org/crystalball/2020-house/\">Sabato's Crystal Ball at the University of Virginia Center for Politics</a>.&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original +0000","feedId":13983,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f3bf983a3eafa001de06bc2?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"3de82f4e4fce72a9c204f2fa137d4643","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn22@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-12-673_c443155aa418f26a.webp","destWidth":2667,"destHeight":2000,"sourceBytes":136748,"destBytes":136748,"author":"mhall@businessinsider.com (Madison Hall,Grace Panetta)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f3bf226a3eafa001de06b82?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn61@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-19-605_bff00b530d967771.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn60@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-18-751_00f09200df8426be.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=sCQqokHDid8:5eq65W0nXsI:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn46@2020_5/2020/09/05/09-01-21-603_6a504c8bf3cab2d4.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=sCQqokHDid8:5eq65W0nXsI:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn62@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-14-348_1fa63cd4ce73393c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=sCQqokHDid8:5eq65W0nXsI:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn15@2020_2/2020/09/05/09-01-18-763_b3aeb1668f164008.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn54@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-18-350_767e235117808cfa.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn12@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-17-769_edf0fa9b5dde1c97.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/clusterstock/~4/sCQqokHDid8":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn84@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-22-808_eb2fef74e2bb9614.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599296467313},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","title":"The UK is using a military drone to monitor and stop migrants from crossing the English channel, after a record 1,400 crossed in August","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/uk-deploys-military-drone-migrants-english-channel-record-crossings-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5214c9e6ff30001d4e70af?format=jpeg\" alt=\"An aerial view shows dinghies stored in a Port Authority yard, believed to have been used by migrants picked up at sea whilst crossing the English Channel, in Dover, south-east England on August 15, 2020. (Photo by BEN STANSALL / AFP) (Photo by BEN STANSALL/AFP via Getty Images)\" height=\"2000\" width=\"4000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An aerial view of dinghies stored in a Port Authority yard, believed to have been used by migrants crossing the English Channel, in Dover, England, on August 15, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">BEN STANSALL/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The UK has deployed a military drone over the English Channel to monitor and stop migrants trying to cross from France, <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/europe/britain-deploys-military-drones-to-stop-migrants-in-rafts-from-crossing-english-channel/2020/09/03/0709643c-edf7-11ea-bd08-1b10132b458f_story.html\">The Washington Post reported.</a></li>\n<li>It's the first time the Watchkeeper WK450 has been used in the UK. It has previously been deployed in Afghanistan, The Post said.</li>\n<li>The drone will relay information to both French and British border authorities, who can then intercept the crossings.</li>\n<li>Prime Minister Boris Johnson said on Wednesday that Channel crossings are illegal, but expressed sympathy for families risking their lives to cross.</li>\n<li>In August, a record 1,468 people made the 20-mile journey. The total number of arrivals is past 5,000 in 2020 so far.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>The UK has deployed a military unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) over the English Channel to monitor — and stop — migrants trying to cross after record numbers arrived in August.</p><p>A British Army Watchkeeper WK450 began surveilling the 20-mile crossing this week and is now relaying information to both the UK Border Force and their French counterparts, <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/europe/britain-deploys-military-drones-to-stop-migrants-in-rafts-from-crossing-english-channel/2020/09/03/0709643c-edf7-11ea-bd08-1b10132b458f_story.html\">according to The Washington Post</a>.</p><p>UK border authorities have been intercepting people aboard fragile boats, with the police saying that there were young children aboard, The Post reported.</p><p>It's the first time the Watchkeeper drone has been used in the UK, but it has previously been deployed in Afghanistan, The Post said.</p><p>The drone, made by the French arms manufacturer Thales, costs $29 million a unit and can fly nonstop for 14 hours with a range of 93 miles.</p><p>So far in 2020, <a href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2020/aug/21/number-of-migrants-crossing-channel-in-boats-passes-5000\">more than 5,000</a> people have crossed from France to the UK.</p><p>In August, a record 1,468 people landed on British beaches, prompting prime minister Boris Johnson on Wednesday <a href=\"https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2020/09/02/sunshine-english-channel-sees-surge-migrants-reaching-uk/\">to promise</a> a renewed effort to reduce the numbers.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f521637e6ff30001d4e70b3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"WATCHKEEPER WK450\" height=\"719\" width=\"1438\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Watchkeeper WK450 seen in 2014.\n<p class=\"copyright\">YouTube/British Defence News</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Johnson said he had \"a great deal of sympathy\" for parents risking the lives of their children to reach the UK, but that Channel crossings were illegal.</p><p>On August 9, the UK government <a href=\"https://www.gov.uk/government/news/home-secretary-appoints-small-boat-commander\">created the new role of Clandestine Channel Threat commander</a>&#160;to make the Channel route \"unviable for small boat crossings.\"</p><p>The Watchkeeper, which is operated by the 47th Regiment Royal Artillery, underwent a trial run on August 31, <a href=\"https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/army-drone-deployed-to-spot-migrants-in-channel-d3qs3nsxh\">The Times of London reported.</a> and began operations this week.</p><p>The drone \"will provide a leading surveillance and reconnaissance capability, feeding information back to the Border Force and allowing them to take appropriate action where necessary,\" a Ministry of Defense spokesman told The Times.</p><p>On Wednesday, a new daily record was set when a total of 409 people arrived in the UK, <a href=\"https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2020/09/02/sunshine-english-channel-sees-surge-migrants-reaching-uk/\">The Telegraph reported</a>.</p><p>The UK's hardline stance on migrant crossings last month <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/ben-and-jerrys-embroiled-in-row-british-government-over-migration-2020-8\">prompted the anger of ice cream maker Ben &#38; Jerry's</a>, which tweeted on its UK corporate account: \"We think the real crisis is our lack of humanity for people fleeing war, climate change, and torture.\"</p><p>British ministers responded by calling Ben &#38; Jerry's \"grossly overpriced ice cream\" and told the company to \"stick to ice cream.\"</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/uk-deploys-military-drone-migrants-english-channel-record-crossings-2020-9'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a
