(Bill Bostock)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f5214c9e6ff30001d4e70af?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn56@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-22-668_2d293828b1185860.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f521637e6ff30001d4e70b3?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn89@2020_6/2020/09/05/09-01-16-809_1177d9b7b43765a6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn60@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-18-751_00f09200df8426be.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=CbcCAsxpHuc:RBYjoAePZx0:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn44@2020_6/2020/09/05/09-01-22-757_063ddd500702a3f1.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=CbcCAsxpHuc:RBYjoAePZx0:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn30@2020_6/2020/09/05/09-01-19-372_e00bbc50329387f4.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=CbcCAsxpHuc:RBYjoAePZx0:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn4@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-23-789_e2188db46a72d01c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn54@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-18-350_767e235117808cfa.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn12@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-17-769_edf0fa9b5dde1c97.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/clusterstock/~4/CbcCAsxpHuc":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn91@2020_6/2020/09/05/09-01-23-674_35c11f01d085bdaa.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599296467319},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","title":"First-term Rep. Chip Roy looks to defend his seat against Wendy Davis in Texas' 21st Congressional District","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/texas-21st-district-house-election-chip-roy-wendy-davis-2020","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f3eb5e842f43f001ddfe15a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"wendy davis\" height=\"1680\" width=\"3360\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">LM Otero/AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>First-term Rep. Chip Roy will face Democrat Wendy Davis, a former state senator and 2014 gubernatorial candidate, in Texas' 21st Congressional District.</li>\n<li>The district is home to much of Austin and the suburbs north of San Antonio, including some of Texas' Hill Country.</li>\n<li>President Trump carried Texas' 21st District by a margin of ten points in the 2016 election.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>&#160;</p><p>First-term <strong>Rep. Chip Roy</strong> looks to retain his new seat against Democrat <strong>Wendy Davis</strong> in Texas' 21st Congressional District.</p><h2>The candidates</h2><p>Roy was a member of former Texas Gov. Rick Perry's staff and presidential campaign. He was the chief of staff for Ted Cruz and played a key role as an architect of the 2013 government shutdown which Cruz led, <a href=\"https://www.dallasnews.com/news/politics/2012/11/28/ted-cruz-picks-chief-of-staff-chip-roy-chief-ghostwriter-on-rick-perry-s-anti-washington-tome-fed-up/\">according to Politico</a>.</p><p>In 2014, Roy became the first assistant attorney general under Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton, a position Roy later left in 2016 <a href=\"https://www.texastribune.org/2016/03/10/chip-roy-joins-pro-ted-cruz-super-pac/\">to lead the Trusted Leadership PAC</a> – a political action committee created to support Cruz's presidential aspirations.</p><p>Davis, Roy's challenger, is a former member of the Texas State Senate – a position she held for 6 years. During her time in the state senate, she led a 13 hours-long filibuster to block a State Senate bill restricting abortion rights in Texas.</p><p>She formerly ran for governor against Republican Greg Abbott in 2014 and ultimately lost. Her <a href=\"https://www.wendydavisforcongress.com/issues\">campaign platform is centered upon</a> investing in schools, combatting climate change, and providing protection for DACA recipients and temporary protected status holders.</p><h2>The district</h2><p>Texas' 21st Congressional District is located in the center of the state and covers the area north of San Antonio and a large portion of Austin. The district is home to Real, Kerr, Kendall, Blanco, Bandera, and Gillespie counties and parts of Bexar, Hays, Travis, and Comal counties.&#160;<sup id=\"cite_ref-1\"><a href=\"https://ballotpedia.org/Texas%27_21st_Congressional_District_election,_2020#cite_note-1\"></a></sup></p><p>The district has not been represented by a Democrat since 1979. Mitt Romney carried the 21st District by 22 points, 60% to 38% in 2012, but Trump carried the District by a smaller margin of ten points, 52% to 42%, in the 2016 election, <a href=\"https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1whYBonfwlgTGnYl7U_IH31G0JNYQ9QBIjDfqkZHkW-0/edit#gid=0\">according to the Daily Kos.</a>&#160;</p><p>In Texas' 2018 US Senate race, Democratic candidate Beto O'Rourke and Republican Sen. Ted Cruz <a href=\"https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1W_GTNylAZfboZkDeMsJPGlir3aQB64SzlVHjY9Xdnkk/edit#gid=562073942\">tied in the district</a> with 49% of the vote each.&#160;</p><h2>The money race</h2><p>According to the <a href=\"https://www.opensecrets.org/races/summary?cycle=2020&id=TX21&spec=Np;spec=N\">Center for Responsive Politics</a>, Davis has raised $4.4 million – about $2 million more than the incumbent, Roy, and has spent $1.4 million compared to $1 million for Roy. Davis also has $2.9 million in cash on hand while Roy has $1.7 million. The <a href=\"https://www.fec.gov/data/candidate/H0TX21148/?cycle=2020&election_full=truetrue\">Federal Election Commission notes</a> that each candidate has received over $300,000 from various political action committees and committees.</p><h2>What some of the experts say</h2><p>The race between Roy and Davis is rated as \"tilts Republican\" by <a href=\"https://insideelections.com/ratings/house\">Inside Elections</a> while <a href=\"https://cookpolitical.com/ratings/house-race-ratings\">The Cook Political Report</a> and <a href=\"http://centerforpolitics.org/crystalball/2020-house/\">Sabato's Crystal Ball at the University of Virginia Center for Politics</a> each rate the race as a \"toss-up.\"</p><div 17:01:07","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","title":"Everything you need to know about Minnesota's 7th Congressional District Race","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/minnesota-house-7th-district-election-collin-peterson-michelle-fischbach-2020","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f32ae6424381727693fec37?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Collin\" height=\"1500\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Rep. Collin Peterson listens to a farmer&#39;s question in 2014.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Danny Johnston/AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Incumbent Democratic Rep. Collin Peterson is facing off against former Lt. Gov Michelle Fishbach in Minnesota's 7th Congressional District.</li>\n<li>The largely rural district covers almost the entire western edge of the state.</li>\n<li>The congressional district is one of 30 House districts won by President Donald Trump in 2016 and also represented by a Democrat.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Democratic <strong>Rep. Collin Peterson</strong> will face former <strong>Lt. Gov. Michelle Fischbach </strong>in the race for Minnesota's 7th Congressional District.</p><p>&#160;</p><h2>The candidates</h2><p>Incumbent Collin Peterson is the House Agriculture Committee Chair, and is the most senior U.S. representative from Minnesota, having held his seat in the House of Representatives since 1991.</p><p>He's also the chairman of the powerful House Agriculture Committee, an extremely influential position on Capitol Hill, and one of the most conservative Democrats in Congress, supporting gun rights, for example, to a far greater extent than many of his Democratic colleagues. But his views and his focus on agricultural and rural areas have helped him remain a strong fit for his district and allowed him to be consistently reelected in his Republican-trending district.&#160;</p><p>Peterson's Republican challenger, Michelle Fischbach, is the former lieutenant governor of Minnesota, serving from 2018 to 2019, as well as the first female president of the Minnesota Senate. Her <a href=\"https://fischbachforcongress.com/issues/\">campaign platform</a> emphasizes supporting the district's farmers, protecting the Second Amendment, and opposing abortion.&#160;</p><h2>The district</h2><p>Minnesota's 7th Congressional District, which covers almost the entire western edge of the state, is <a href=\"http://centerforpolitics.org/crystalball/2020-house/\">one of 30 congressional districts</a> won by President Donald Trump in 2016 but represented by a Democrat.</p><p>The 7th District is the Democratic-controlled district that Trump carried by the greatest margin, winning it by 30 percentage points over Hillary Clinton, in 2016.&#160;</p><p>It is the largest congressional district in Minnesota, occupying most of the Western part of the state and stretching from the Canadian border down to the southern part of the state. Its largest cities include Fergus Falls, Willmar, Moorhead, and Alexandria.</p><h2>The money race</h2><p>According to the <a href=\"https://www.opensecrets.org/races/summary?cycle=2020&id=MN07MN07\">Center for Responsive Politics</a>, Peterson has raised $1.2 million compared to Fischbach's $1 million.&#160; Having spent only $423,000 on this election, Peterson has more than $1 million in cash on hand than his challenger.</p><p>While her campaign totals are below that of her incumbent opponent, donations to Fischbach's campaign are setting records. According to her campaign, Fischbach's $1 million raised sets a record as the <a href=\"https://fischbachforcongress.com/press/fischbach-sets-a-new-fundraising-record/\">highest raising Republican</a> candidate in the 7th Congressional District's history.</p><h2>What some of the experts say</h2><p><a href=\"https://cookpolitical.com/ratings/house-race-ratings\"></a>The fight for Minnesota's 7th Congressional District seat is rated a tossup by <a href=\"http://centerforpolitics.org/crystalball/2020-house/\">Sabato's Crystal Ball at the University of Virginia Center for Politics</a> and <a href=\"https://cookpolitical.com/ratings/house-race-ratings\">the Cook Political Report</a>, and tilts Democratic according to <a href=\"https://insideelections.com/ratings/house\">Inside Elections.</a></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 20:26:50 +0000","feedId":13983,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f24664caee6a837217f1038?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"1a3d41e7533b58923c1e9247e35547f4","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn17@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-12-755_05f8fe07f3eb927c.webp","destWidth":3156,"destHeight":2367,"sourceBytes":443456,"destBytes":443456,"author":"mhall@businessinsider.com (Madison Hall)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f32ae6424381727693fec37?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn40@2020_5/2020/09/05/09-01-18-670_85506d7eb7c675ca.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn60@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-18-751_00f09200df8426be.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=sqRkLACrHRk:jMHeVq5mve0:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn70@2020_2/2020/09/05/09-01-18-545_e268fe2de2504cc5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=sqRkLACrHRk:jMHeVq5mve0:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn50@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-21-691_0985a352f116b597.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=sqRkLACrHRk:jMHeVq5mve0:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn43@2020_2/2020/09/05/09-01-15-102_aac63fec77d05759.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn54@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-18-350_767e235117808cfa.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn12@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-17-769_edf0fa9b5dde1c97.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/clusterstock/~4/sqRkLACrHRk":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn60@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-22-687_b490965ccd62ed75.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599296467314},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","title":"First-term Rep. Susan Wild will face Republican Lisa Scheller in Pennsylvania's 7th Congressional District","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/pennsylvania-7th-district-house-election-susan-wild-lisa-scheller-2020","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f3e825742f43f001ddfdfce?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Rep Susan Wild\" height=\"2736\" width=\"5472\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Rep. Susan Wild, D-Pa., left, accompanied by Rep. Rashida Tlaib, D-Mich., right, laugh as she takes the podium to speak at a news conference on Capitol Hill in Washington, Thursday, Jan. 17, 2019, to unveil the &#34;Immediate Financial Relief for Federal Employees Act&#34; bill which would give zero interest loans for up to $6,000 to employees impacted by the government shutdown and any future shutdowns.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Andrew Harnik/AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>First-term Rep. Susan Wild will face Republican Lisa Scheller in Pennsylvania's 7th Congressional District.</li>\n<li>Pennsylvania's congressional map was re-drawn in early 2019 after the Supreme Court of Pennsylvania declared its previous districts gerrymandered along partisan lones.</li>\n<li>Scheller has so far taken on a loan of $1.2 million to fund her campaign, accounting for 65 percent of her total campaign funding.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>&#160;</p><p>First-term <strong>Rep. Susan Wild</strong> looks to defend her seat against Republican challenger <strong>Lisa Scheller</strong> in Pennsylvania's 7th Congressional District.</p><h2>The candidates</h2><p>Wild, the incumbent, is currently the <a href=\"https://wildforcongress.com/meet-susan\">only Jewish Pennsylvanian</a> to hold federal office and the first woman to represent Lehigh Valley. She currently sits on the House committees on Foreign Affairs, Ethics, and Education and the Workplace. Wild <a href=\"https://wildforcongress.com/endorsements\">holds endorsements from</a> the Planned Parenthood Action Fund, the End Citizens United PAC, and The Humane Society.</p><p>Scheller, Wild's challenger, is the current <a href=\"https://www.silberline.com/about-us/\">chairman of Silberline Manufacturing Co</a>., an aluminum paint pigment manufacturer founded by her grandparents. After opening up about her past experiences with drug and alcohol addiction, she spearheaded the creation of Hope &#38; Coffee, a restaurant and coffee shop free from drugs and alcohol which provides support groups for young audiences with a history of substance abuse.&#160;</p><p>Scheller's <a href=\"https://schellerforcongress.com/priorities/\">campaign is centered on</a> combatting opioid addiction, working with the U.S. budget, ending sanctuary city funding, and fighting against the proposed Green New Deal resolution.</p><h2>The district</h2><p>Pennsylvania's 7th Congressional District is located on the state's eastern edge. The district is home to all of Lehigh and Northampton counties and a portion of Monroe County. The state's congressional map was re-drawn in January 2019 after the Supreme Court of Pennsylvania ruled that its <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/supreme-court-pennsylvania-redistricting-gerrymandering-case-2018-2\">previous form was overtly gerrymandered</a>.</p><p>The new boundaries of the 7th District made it significantly more friendly to Democrats. Former President Barack Obama would have carried the district, under its new lines, by seven percentage points in 2012 and 2016 Democratic nominee Hillary Clinton would have carried it by one point, <a href=\"https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1whYBonfwlgTGnYl7U_IH31G0JNYQ9QBIjDfqkZHkW-0/edit#gid=0\">according to the Daily Kos.&#160;</a></p><h2>The money race</h2><p>According to the Federal Election Commission, <a href=\"https://www.fec.gov/data/candidate/H8PA15229/?cycle=2020&election_full=truetrue\">Wild has received $2.8 million</a> in campaign contributions compared to Scheller's $1.85 million. Wild has about $2.1 million in cash on hand – 3 times more than Scheller with $700,000.&#160;</p><p>Wild's campaign contributions are mostly from supporters, while <a href=\"https://www.fec.gov/data/candidate/H0PA07132/?cycle=2020&election_full=truetrue\">Scheller took out a $1.2 million in loans</a> for her campaign – about 65 percent of her total campaign funds.</p><h2>What some of the experts say</h2><p>The race between Wild and Scheller is rated as \"leans Democratic\" by <a href=\"https://cookpolitical.com/ratings/house-race-ratings\">The Cook Political Report</a> and <a href=\"http://centerforpolitics.org/crystalball/2020-house/\">Sabato's Crystal Ball at the University of Virginia Center for Politics</a>. It is also rated as \"safe Democratic\" by <a href=\"https://insideelections.com/ratings/house\">Inside Elections</a>.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/pennsylvania-7th-district-house-election-susan-wild-lisa-scheller-2020'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/clusterstock/~4/uNgWka28Ppk\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 20:44:22 +0000","feedId":13983,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f52a7e47ed0ee001e25daa5?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"7e12a7b6a7c38eec763d3e1aca59a15f","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn50@2020_2/2020/09/05/09-01-12-699_570181f6770a1c7e.webp","destWidth":3543,"destHeight":2657,"sourceBytes":309736,"destBytes":309736,"author":"mhall@businessinsider.com (Madison Hall,Grace Panetta)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f3e825742f43f001ddfdfce?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn4@2020_5/2020/09/05/09-01-14-811_291f25610866e0ed.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn60@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-18-751_00f09200df8426be.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=uNgWka28Ppk:70M1EO46WWo:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn32@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-22-496_648857602e7bce23.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=uNgWka28Ppk:70M1EO46WWo:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn54@2020_5/2020/09/05/09-01-15-853_0c3c0f1157db3a77.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=uNgWka28Ppk:70M1EO46WWo:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn11@2020_6/2020/09/05/09-01-21-572_50de4b3f926f466c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn54@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-18-350_767e235117808cfa.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn12@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-17-769_edf0fa9b5dde1c97.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/clusterstock/~4/uNgWka28Ppk":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn48@2020_6/2020/09/05/09-01-15-782_d0851a80c43193df.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599296467310},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","title":"First-term Rep. Susie Lee faces off against Republican Daniel Rodimer in Nevada's 3rd Congressional District","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/nevada-3rd-district-house-election-susie-lee-daniel-rodimer-2020","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f3c0ee9650894001d07226c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"FILE - In this Jan. 17, 2019, file photo Rep. Susie Lee, D-Nev., speaks at a news conference on Capitol Hill in Washington. At least 10 lawmakers and three congressional caucuses have ties to organizations that received federal coronavirus aid, according to government data released this week. A regional casino company led by the husband of Rep. Susie Lee received money. (AP Photo/Andrew Harnik, File)\" height=\"2736\" width=\"5472\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>In this Jan. 17, 2019 photo, Rep. Susie Lee, D-Nev., speaks at a news conference on Capitol Hill in Washington. At least 10 lawmakers and three congressional caucuses have ties to organizations that received federal coronavirus aid, according to government data released this week. A regional casino company led by the husband of Rep. Susie Lee received money. (AP Photo/Andrew Harnik, File)\n<p class=\"copyright\">Associated Press</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>First-term Rep. Susie Lee will face Republican Dan Rodimer in Nevada's 3rd congressional district.</li>\n<li>The district is <a href=\"http://centerforpolitics.org/crystalball/2020-house/\">one of thirty districts</a> which voted for President Donald Trump in 2016 but is currently represented in the House by a Democrat.</li>\n<li>Rodimer is a former WWE wrestler who previously ran for a spot in Nevada's State Senate in 2018.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>&#160;</p><p>First-term <strong>Rep. Susie Lee</strong> looks to retain her seat against Republican challenger<strong> Dan Rodimer</strong> in Nevada's 3rd congressional district.</p><h2>The candidates</h2><p>Before her time in politics, Lee dedicated her career to assisting Nevada's educational systems and lowering dropout rates. She was the founding director of the After-School All-Stars, an after-school program for thousands of students. She also served as the <a href=\"https://www.cisnevada.org/cis-of-nevada-board-chair-susie-lee-awarded-2015-humanitarian-of-the-year/\">president of Communities In Schools of Nevada</a>, a dropout prevention organization.</p><p>In 2016, Lee ran in the Democratic primaries to represent the state's 4th Congressional District. She placed third behind now-Rep. Ruben Kihuen and Lucy Flores. In 2018, however, she succeeded in her bid to replace former Representative and now-Senator Jacky Rosen in the 3rd District.</p><p>Rodimer, Lee's Republican opponent, is a former professional wrestler and arena football player. He has received <a href=\"https://danrodimer.com/endorsements/\">endorsements from House Minority Leader</a> Rep. Kevin McCarthy, the National Rifle Association, the National Right to Life Committee, and television celebrity Rick Harrison from the show \"Pawn Stars.\" Rodimer's <a href=\"https://danrodimer.com/issues/\">campaign platform is centered on</a> supporting law enforcement, opening the healthcare marketplace, and securing the country's borders.</p><p>In 2018, Rodimer ran for Nevada's State Senate in the state's 8th district, but lost in the Republican primary to Valerie Weber.</p><h2>The district</h2><p>Nevada's 3rd congressional district is the state's southernmost district. The district is located directly south of Las Vegas and contains the cities of Henderson, Summerlin South, Boulder City, Searchlight, Laughlin and parts of unincorporated Clark County.</p><p>The district is one of thirty in the United States which voted for President Trump in 2016 but is currently represented by a Democrat. This district flipped from narrowly backing former President Baack Obama by a margin of less than one percentage point in 2012 to voting for Trump also by one point, <a href=\"https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1whYBonfwlgTGnYl7U_IH31G0JNYQ9QBIjDfqkZHkW-0/edit#gid=0\">according to the Daily Kos.&#160;</a></p><p>As Lee won her race in 2018, Democratic Sen. Jacky Rosen carried the district <a href=\"https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/15pwjFcLtVFstC8cpSZYoIYyu-mrfL0g0jjZ-u48k-Qk/edit#gid=336177061\">by a little under five percentage points</a> in her race against former GOP Sen. Dean Heller. Also that year, Democratic Gov. Steve Sisolak carried the district by four points in his gubernatorial campaign, <a href=\"https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1HXedC4gpOJn5U3ZpjJmBIX_D7qOIyyM1fXHpKBIT-sQ/edit#gid=1608183133\">according to the Daily Kos.&#160;</a></p><h2>The money race</h2><p>According to the <a href=\"https://www.opensecrets.org/races/summary?cycle=2020&id=NV03NV03\">Center for Responsive Politics</a>, Lee has significantly outraised Rodimer. Lee has received $3.2 million in donations compared to Rodimer's $880,000. Rodimer has only $254,000 remaining to fund his campaign, $2.2 million less than Lee's $2.4 million on hand.&#160;</p><h2>What some of the experts say</h2><p>The race between Lee and Rodimer is rated as \"leans Democratic\" by <a href=\"https://insideelections.com/ratings/house\">Inside Elections</a> and <a href=\"https://cookpolitical.com/ratings/house-race-ratings\">The Cook Political Report</a>. <a href=\"http://centerforpolitics.org/crystalball/2020-house/\">Sabato's Crystal Ball at the University of Virginia Center for Politics</a> rates the race as \"likely Democratic.\"</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/nevada-3rd-district-house-election-susie-lee-daniel-rodimer-2020'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?a=IaADZXaKc2s:rJhE9ebxSZk:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img 17:01:07","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","title":"'Miracle on the Hudson' pilot 'Sully' Sullenberger slammed Trump after reports the president called US troops killed in combat 'losers'","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/sully-pilot-trump-troops-losers-miracle-hudson-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d09b6e2638af219237e1c72?format=jpeg\" alt=\"FILE - In this June 11, 2011, file photo, former Capt. Chesley &#34;Sully&#34; Sullenberger talks to the media in front of the US Airways flight 1549 aircraft at the Carolina Aviation Museum in Charlotte, N.C. The president of the pilots&#39; union at American Airlines says Boeing made mistakes in its design of the 737 Max and not telling pilots about new flight-control software on the plane. Sullenberger, the captain who safely landed a disabled jetliner on the Hudson River in 2009, is also expected to testify. He has said that Boeing was more focused on protecting its product, the Max, than protecting the people who use it. (AP Photo/Chuck Burton, File)\" height=\"2603\" width=\"3564\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>FILE - In this June 11, 2011, file photo, former Capt. Chesley &#34;Sully&#34; Sullenberger talks to the media in front of the US Airways flight 1549 aircraft at the Carolina Aviation Museum in Charlotte, N.C. The president of the pilots&#39; union at American Airlines says Boeing made mistakes in its design of the 737 Max and not telling pilots about new flight-control software on the plane. Sullenberger, the captain who safely landed a disabled jetliner on the Hudson River in 2009, is also expected to testify. He has said that Boeing was more focused on protecting its product, the Max, than protecting the people who use it. (AP Photo/Chuck Burton, File)\n<p class=\"copyright\">Associated Press</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/donald-trump\">President Trump</a> was slammed on Friday by <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/sully-sullenberger\">Chesley Burnett \"Sully\" Sullenberger III</a>, the pilot famous for <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/miracle-on-the-hudson\">landing a damaged plane on the Hudson River</a> in 2009, saving all 155 people on board.</li>\n<li>Sully, a US Air Force veteran, criticized Trump as \"a coward\" who is \"completely unfit for\" office in a scathing Twitter thread.</li>\n<li>Sully, a registered Republican, tweeted the comments in response to reports that Trump <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-called-marines-died-wwi-losers-suckers-report-2020-9\">referred to fallen soldiers</a> as \"suckers\" and \"losers,\" and that the president <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-questioned-kellys-sons-sacrifice-on-memorial-day-grave-visit-2020-9\">did not understand</a> why people chose to serve in the armed forces.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>The pilot famous for successfully landing a damaged plane on the Hudson River struck out at President Donald Trump on Friday, responding to reports that Trump repeatedly disparaged active duty and veteran servicemen and women.</p><p>Captain Chesley Burnett \"Sully\" Sullenberger III tweeted on Friday in response to a report from <a href=\"https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2020/09/trump-americans-who-died-at-war-are-losers-and-suckers/615997/\">The Atlantic</a>. The president said that <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-called-marines-died-wwi-losers-suckers-report-2020-9\">Marines who died</a> in World War I were \"suckers\" and \"losers,\" and said he <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-didnt-want-wounded-veterans-military-parade-report-2020-9\">did not want</a> wounded soldiers featured in a military parade because \"no one wants to see that,\" according to The Atlantic report, which was confirmed by <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fox-news-correspondent-confirms-trump-said-dead-us-troops-losers-2020-9\">a Fox News correspondent</a>.</p><p>According to The Atlantic, Trump also&#160;questioned those who choose to serve in the armed forces, rather than following a higher-earning career path, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-questioned-kellys-sons-sacrifice-on-memorial-day-grave-visit-2020-9\">asking</a> \"[w]hat's in it for them?\"</p><p>Sullenberger, who served as a fighter pilot in the US Air Force before becoming a commercial pilot for US Airways from 1980-2010, tweeted Friday evening calling Trump \"selfish\" and \"a coward,\" accusing the president of being \"completely unfit for\" and having \"no respect for the office he holds.\"</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Sully Sullenberger  (@Captsully) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1301998157404962823?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">September 4, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>&#160;</p><p>\"I have long known that serving a cause greater than oneself is the highest calling, whether in the military or in civilian life. And I have always tried to be a voice of reason and to speak in a measured way,\" Sullenberger tweeted. \"But this situation calls for a much more direct approach. It is time to call out egregious behavior for what it is.\"</p><p>\"For the first time in American history, a president has repeatedly shown utter and vulgar contempt and disrespect for those who have served and died serving our country,\" he added.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5773f671dd0895ce458b4a82?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Hudson Plane Landing Sullenberger\" height=\"1333\" width=\"2200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>US Airways Flight 1549 lost both engines after striking a flock of geese while departing New York&#39;s LaGuardia Airport in 2009.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Sullenberger was the pilot in command of US Airways Flight 1549 in January 2009, when the plane struck a flock of geese while departing New York's LaGuardia Airport. The plane lost power in both engines. Sullenberger determined that the plane could not successfully reach a runway, and instead made an emergency crash landing on the Hudson River. All 155 people on board survived.</p><p>Sullenberger has worked as an aviation safety expert and speaker since retiring from US Airways in 2010.</p><p>A registered Republican who <a href=\"https://thehill.com/homenews/campaign/61179-gop-recruited-hero-captain-sully-for-2010-congress-run-\">was approached by the GOP in 2009</a> about running for Congress, Sullenberger endorsed Democratic nominee Joe Biden for president earlier this year.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/sully-pilot-trump-troops-losers-miracle-hudson-2020-9'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a 03:04:15 +0000","feedId":13983,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f52fa31e6ff30001d4e748d?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"bd07e7b53b2adceb7b4356e846ef2817","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn1@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-12-674_15b8d2be6103b455.webp","destWidth":3470,"destHeight":2603,"sourceBytes":248564,"destBytes":248564,"author":"dslotnick@businessinsider.com (David Slotnick)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5d09b6e2638af219237e1c72?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn11@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-23-824_94ca257650f3fd03.webp","https://i.insider.com/5773f671dd0895ce458b4a82?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn33@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-19-420_1ca4f3542bd9dae9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn60@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-18-751_00f09200df8426be.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=N2s5-DExKAk:DREhMKeWju8:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn57@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-21-801_ce6597cb060063f3.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=N2s5-DExKAk:DREhMKeWju8:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn80@2020_6/2020/09/05/09-01-22-758_223e3e1638fcd6f5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=N2s5-DExKAk:DREhMKeWju8:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn19@2020_5/2020/09/05/09-01-18-796_a52497faceebc59a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn54@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-18-350_767e235117808cfa.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn12@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-17-769_edf0fa9b5dde1c97.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/clusterstock/~4/N2s5-DExKAk":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn34@2020_2/2020/09/05/09-01-23-409_f20e448aa3e110d0.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599296467319},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","title":"11 freshmen at Northeastern were dismissed for violating COVID-19 rules. Their $35,000 tuition won't be reimbursed.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/11-northeastern-students-dismissed-breaking-covid-19-rules-party-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f52c3787ed0ee001e25db25?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Northeastern university\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Northeastern University dorm West Village E Hall is being prepped to use for emergency housing in Boston on April 9, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">David L. Ryan/The Boston Globe via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>A group of Northeastern students was dismissed for violating the university's coronavirus rules after they were reportedly caught gathered in a room without wearing masks or socially distancing.</li>\n<li>Tuition and room fees for the 11 students won't be reimbursed.</li>\n<li>The students also won't be able to take their courses online but are eligible to return to school in the spring.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Eleven first-year Northeastern students were dismissed for violating the university's coronavirus rules after reportedly being caught without wearing masks or socially distancing when gathered in a room.&#160;</p><p>\"The students have been informed that they are no longer part of the Northeastern community for the fall semester. They have the right to contest their dismissal at an expedited hearing,\" a <a href=\"https://news.northeastern.edu/2020/09/04/northeastern-dismisses-11-students-for-gathering-in-violation-of-covid-19-policies/\">statement</a> on the university's website read.&#160;</p><p>The statement added that the students would have to take a coronavirus test before they leave. In an effort to limit the spread of the virus, those who test positive will have to stay in \"wellness housing\" on campus until they recover.&#160;</p><p>\"Northeastern and its community of students, faculty, and staff take violations of health and safety protocols very seriously,\" said Madeleine Estabrook, senior vice chancellor for student affairs at Northeastern. \"Cooperation and compliance with public health guidelines is absolutely essential. Those people who do not follow the guidelines — including wearing masks, avoiding parties and other gatherings, practicing healthy distancing, washing your hands, and getting tested — are putting everyone else at risk.\"</p><p>The 11 students were found in a room at the Westin Hotel in Boston on Wednesday. <a href=\"https://www.bostonglobe.com/2020/09/04/metro/northeastern-dismisses-11-first-year-students-partying/\">The Boston Globe</a> reported that the Westin Hotel was being used as a temporary dormitory this semester and each room is meant for two people.&#160;</p><p>Program staff found the students when they were making rounds in the hotel. It is not yet clear why the students were gathered in the room.&#160;</p><p>The students were part of a special one-semester program for first-year students and according to Globe, the prepaid $36,500 cost for the semester won't be refunded. Students won't be able to take courses from home but are eligible to return in the fall.&#160;</p><p>Additionally, housing fees won't be refunded to the students.&#160;</p><p>Other students told the Globe that the dismissal sent a strong message from the university about taking coronavirus seriously.&#160;</p><p>\"I was upset because it's just really stupid to go around and still have these social gatherings. Those kinds of things are just going to ruin everything for everyone else,\" Darren Ng, a first-year from New York City told the Globe.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.nbcboston.com/news/local/northeastern-university-dismisses-11-students-for-attending-hotel-party/2189566/\">WBTS</a> reported that just two weeks ago, university officials sent letters to 115 students and their parents that threatened to expel any student who didn't abide by coronavirus social distancing guidelines after the students posted online that they intended to party.&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/11-northeastern-students-dismissed-breaking-covid-19-rules-party-2020-9'>Business 17:01:07","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","title":"Tyler Perry is officially a billionaire, according to Forbes estimates. Take a look at how the Hollywood mogul makes and spends his fortune.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/tyler-perry-billionaire-career-makes-spends-billion-dollar-fortune-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4fb4ce7ed0ee001e25cfd4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"FILE - In this Nov. 16, 2017, file photo, actor-filmmaker and author Tyler Perry poses for a portrait in New York. Perry is looking to reopen his 330-acre Atlanta-based mega studio soon, but other studios in Georgia are anxiously waiting for Hollywood&#39;s green light to return back to work. Perry plans on restarting production at the Tyler Perry Studios complex in July, making it one of the first studios to domestically reopen after production was halted a few months ago to combat the spread of the coronavirus. (Photo by Amy Sussman/Invision/AP, File)\" height=\"2215\" width=\"2954\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Actor-filmmaker and author Tyler Perry poses for a portrait in New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Associated Press</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Tyler Perry is officially worth $1 billion, per <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/maddieberg/2020/09/01/from-poor-as-hell-to-billionaire-how-tyler-perry-changed-show-business-forever/#6a12f8434b51\">Forbes estimates</a>.</li>\n<li>The newly minted billionaire has been a Hollywood heavy-hitter for years, thanks to his mega-successful Madea franchise and his 330-acre Tyler Perry Studios in Atlanta, Georgia.</li>\n<li>Take a look inside how he makes and spends his money.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>&#160;</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tOn September 1, Forbes added a new name to its list of Hollywood billionaires: Tyler Perry. With an estimated net worth of $1 billion, Perry joined the six-figure net worth ranks of Oprah Winfrey, George Lucas, John de Mol, and Steven Spielberg.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5267ffe6ff30001d4e723c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Writer-director-actor Tyler Perry attends the premiere of Tyler Perry&#39;s &#34;A Fall from Grace,&#34; at Metrograph, Monday, Jan. 13, 2020, in New York. (Photo by Evan Agostini/Invision/AP)\" height=\"2280\" width=\"3048\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Writer-director-actor Tyler Perry attends the premiere of Tyler Perry&#39;s &#34;A Fall from Grace,&#34; at Metrograph, Monday, Jan. 13, 2020, in New York. (Photo by Evan Agostini/Invision/AP)\n<p class=\"copyright\">Associated Press</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/maddieberg/2020/09/01/from-poor-as-hell-to-billionaire-how-tyler-perry-changed-show-business-forever/#460d180c34b5\">Forbes</a></em></p>\n\tForbes broke down his empire into five key areas, among which are his cash and investments, his stake in the video-on-demand service BET+, and his sprawling Tyler Perry Studios in Atlanta, Georgia.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5268a9e6ff30001d4e7245?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tyler Perry\" height=\"2951\" width=\"3935\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Prince Williams/Wireimage/Getty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/maddieberg/2020/09/01/from-poor-as-hell-to-billionaire-how-tyler-perry-changed-show-business-forever/#460d180c34b5\">Forbes</a></em></p>\n\tPerry, 50, was born and raised in New Orleans, Louisiana. He shared a close relationship with his mother, who died in 2009. He is estranged from his father.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5284dae6ff30001d4e7342?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tyler Perry mother\" height=\"1773\" width=\"2364\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Michael Tran/FilmMagic/Getty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source:<a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/maddieberg/2020/09/01/from-poor-as-hell-to-billionaire-how-tyler-perry-changed-show-business-forever/#460d180c34b5\"> Forbes</a>, <a href=\"https://www.seattletimes.com/entertainment/movie-producer-tyler-perrys-mother-dies-at-age-64/\">Seattle Times</a></em></p>\n\tPerry and his long-term partner, the model and activist Gelila Bekele, have one son, Aman. He is based in Atlanta.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f52852ee6ff30001d4e7344?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tyler Perry Gelila bekele\" height=\"1579\" width=\"2106\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Gary Gershoff/WireImage/Getty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.ajc.com/news/tyler-perry-says-his-longtime-girlfriend-will-get-her-share-his-wealth/LxZFjInvKOeSC4l2l8ILNM/\">AJC</a></em></p>\n\tPerry had got his start in theater. His first play — I Know I've Been Changed — opened to a mostly empty theatre. Thirteen years and many other plays later, he released his first film, Diary of a Mad Black Woman, in 2005, jumpstarting his Madea franchise. The movie made $22.7 million in its opening weekend.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f52859a7ed0ee001e25d9d8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tyler Perry\" height=\"2007\" width=\"2676\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tyler Perry, winner of Outstanding Theatrical Film for &#34;Diary of a Mad Black Woman&#34;\n<p class=\"copyright\">M. Caulfield/WireImage for BET Network</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://tylerperry.com/tyler/story/\">Tyler Perry</a>, <a href=\"https://www.foxnews.com/story/mad-black-woman-seizes-box-office\">Fox&#160;</a></em></p>\n\tOne of Perry's best-known projects is the movie franchise Madea, in which Perry himself dresses as an elderly Black woman and plays the titular role. In an appearance on the Today show, Perry said that him playing the role happened by accident.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4fac3ee6ff30001d4e696f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"tyler perry madea\" height=\"1630\" width=\"2174\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tyler Perry as Madea during a 2017 appearance on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Andrew Lipovsky/NBCU Photo Bank/NBCUniversal via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.today.com/video/tyler-perry-reveals-how-he-created-his-madea-character-1103552579871\">Today</a></em></p>\n\tPerry made 11 Madea movies over the course of 15 years. The final installment — A Madea Family Funeral — made $27 million in its March 2019 opening weekend. Perry made the highest-grossing Madea movie, Madea Goes to Jail, exactly a decade prior to that. It brought in $90 million in total box office earnings in 2009.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5269507ed0ee001e25d8e1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Madea tyler perry jimmy fallon\" height=\"842\" width=\"1123\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Andrew Lipovsky/NBCU Photo Bank/NBCUniversal via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://variety.com/2019/film/news/tyler-perry-box-office-madea-1203153966/\">Variety</a>, <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/simonthompson/2019/03/03/now-a-madea-family-funeral-is-out-every-madea-movie-box-office-opening-ranked-worst-to-best/#7b1fc7064971\">Forbes</a></em></p>\n\tAll of Perry's Madea movies were distributed by studio giant Lionsgate. The films collectively brought in over $1 billion in ticket sales while the production cost of each was approximately $20 million. It is unclear how much Perry has personally made from the franchise.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f52698ce6ff30001d4e724e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Madea poster\" height=\"1950\" width=\"2600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">John Parra/Getty Images for Lionsgate</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://variety.com/2019/film/news/tyler-perry-box-office-madea-1203153966/\">Variety</a>, <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/03/movies/a-madea-family-funeral-box-office.html\">New York Times</a></em></p>\n\tPerry and Lionsgate had a \"first look\" deal for eight years from 2008 to 2014. In a first-look deal, the creator owns the copyright to his material.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5269b5e6ff30001d4e724f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"tyler perry billionaire\" height=\"1664\" width=\"2225\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tyler Perry is America&#39;s newest billionaire, according to Forbes.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Axelle/Bauer-Griffin/FilmMagic</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://variety.com/2014/film/news/lionsgate-ends-first-look-pact-with-tyler-perry-1201123477/\">Variety</a>, <a href=\"https://www.kenningtongroff.com/post/difference-between-an-overall-deal-a-first-look\">Kennington Groff</a></em></p>\n\tSince parting ways with Lionsgate, Perry has had a number of much-talked-about partnerships with Viacom, BET's parent company, and the Oprah Winfrey Network.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f526a287ed0ee001e25d8e9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Oprah Winfrey Tyler Perry\" height=\"2075\" width=\"2766\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">JB Lacroix/WireImage/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/oprah-winfrey-own-tyler-perry-375328\">THR</a></em></p>\n\tForbes estimates that approximately $60 million of his billion-dollar net worth comes from his stake in BET+.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f526ae27ed0ee001e25d8f2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tyler Perry\" height=\"3086\" width=\"4115\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Marcus Ingram/Getty Images for BET</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/maddieberg/2020/09/01/from-poor-as-hell-to-billionaire-how-tyler-perry-changed-show-business-forever/#460d180c34b5\">Forbes</a></em></p>\n\tIn 2017, Perry signed a contract with Viacom, BET's parent company, to produce exclusive original content for BET. The deal is slated to run through 2024 and didn't start until 2019, after Perry's contract with OWN ended.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f526cf1e6ff30001d4e727b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Viacom\" height=\"2213\" width=\"2951\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">AaronP/Bauer-Griffin/GC Images/Getty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Source: <a href=\"https://money.cnn.com/2017/07/14/media/tyler-perry-viacom/index.html\">CNN</a>, <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2017/07/14/arts/television/viacom-poaches-tyler-perry-from-oprah-winfreys-network.html\">NYT</a></p><p>&#160;</p><p>&#160;</p><p>&#160;</p><p>&#160;</p>\n\tThis multi-year partnership grew into a creating a video-on-demand subscription service in 2019 known as BET Plus, Variety reported. It will feature Perry's extensive library of work as well as BET programming.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f526d287ed0ee001e25d90d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"bet network logo\" height=\"1135\" width=\"1514\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">BET</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://variety.com/2019/tv/news/tyler-perry-bet-plus-viacom-streaming-service-1203251300/\">Variety</a></em></p>\n\tIn 2015, Perry forked out $30 million to buy over 300 acres of a former US Army base in Atlanta. Tyler Perry Studios sits on that plot. Forbes estimates the studio is worth $280 million.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f526c4be6ff30001d4e7275?format=jpeg\" alt=\"tyler perry studios\" height=\"2432\" width=\"3242\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paras Griffin/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://atlanta.curbed.com/2019/10/7/20902752/tyler-perry-southwest-atlanta-movie-studio\">Curbed Atlanta</a>,</em> <em><a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/maddieberg/2020/09/01/from-poor-as-hell-to-billionaire-how-tyler-perry-changed-show-business-forever/#460d180c34b5\">Forbes</a></em></p><p>&#160;</p>\n\tIndieWire noted that the land used to be a base for the Confederate Army, a point Perry has acknowledged. In a 2019 BET awards speech, he said, \"while you're fighting for a seat at the table, I'll be down in Atlanta building my own.\"\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f526c067ed0ee001e25d8fd?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tyler Perry BET award\" height=\"2353\" width=\"3131\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Kevin Winter/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.indiewire.com/2019/10/tyler-perry-interview-atlanta-studio-1202177041/\">IndieWire</a>, <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DVjjSxpqbOo&#38;feature=emb_title\">BET</a></em></p>\n\tMarvel megahit \"Black Panther\" was one of the first movies shot at the studio's new stages, AJC reported. Perry took Architectural Digest on a tour of the property in 2019, which gave viewers an inside look at the studio, which comes with neighborhoods, mansions, and even a replica of the White House.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f354e1be89ebf001f04448c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Black Panther hed\" height=\"1200\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Black Panther was directed by Ryan Coogler.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Source: <em><a href=\"https://www.ajc.com/news/world/black-panther-was-the-first-movie-filmed-tyler-perry-studios-new-stages/O37OBGUaCloW20QIL9Hi5I/\">AJC</a>, <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zgacuXdzCmw&#38;feature=emb_logo\">Architectural Digest</a></em></p>\n\tPerry has built an impressive real estate portfolio over the years that consists of several multimillion-dollar properties in Atlanta, Los Angeles, and Wyoming.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f526c9ee6ff30001d4e7276?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tyler Perry\" height=\"2494\" width=\"3325\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Slaven Vlasic/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/maddieberg/2020/09/01/from-poor-as-hell-to-billionaire-how-tyler-perry-changed-show-business-forever/#460d180c34b5\">Forbes</a></em></p>\n\tPerry bought a 34,000-square-foot house in Atlanta in 2007 for $9 million. It has seven bedrooms, 14 bathrooms, a helipad, an infinity pool, and a tennis court.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ef1262f19182445cf04be93?format=jpeg\" alt=\"atlanta highway\" height=\"2000\" width=\"2667\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Light traffic into downtown Atlanta during the coronavirus pandemic.\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP Photo/John Bazemore</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.architecturaldigest.com/story/tyler-perry-former-atlanta-estate-new-owner\">Architectural Digest</a></em></p>\n\tHe sold the home to David Turner, an entrepreneur and evangelist, nine years later in 2016 for $17.5 million. Steve Harvey bought the house for $15 million in June 2020.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f3d8f6842f43f001ddfde98?format=jpeg\" alt=\"steve harvey\" height=\"767\" width=\"1023\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Byron Cohen/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.architecturaldigest.com/story/tyler-perry-former-atlanta-estate-new-owner\">Architectural Digest</a>, <a href=\"https://variety.com/2020/dirt/entertainers/steve-harvey-buys-tyler-perrys-15-million-former-atlanta-mansion-1234622557/\">Variety</a></em></p>\n\tPerry owns a mansion worth $18 million in the swanky Beverly Hills neighborhood.  The eight-bedroom and 12-bathroom villa played host to The Duke and Duchess of Sussex earlier this year. It is unclear if they rented the property or stayed there as guests. The couple's representatives declined to comment to Insider at the time.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f526b3be6ff30001d4e7262?format=jpeg\" alt=\"FILE PHOTO: Britain&#39;s Prince Harry and his wife Meghan, Duchess of Sussex visit Canada House in London, Britain  January 7, 2020. Daniel Leal-Olivas/Pool via REUTERS\" height=\"3473\" width=\"4631\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Duke and Duchess of Sussex visit Canada House\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/meghan-marke-prince-harry-tyler-perry-beverly-hills-home-report-2020-5?r=US&#38;IR=T\">Business Insider</a>, <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/photos-meghan-markle-harry-la-mansion-owned-by-tyler-perry-2020-5\">Insider</a>,&#160;<a href=\"https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-8297083/Meghan-Harry-living-Tyler-Perrys-18-million-hilltop-mansion-Beverly-Hills.html\">Daily Mail</a></em></p><p>&#160;</p>\n\tArchitectural Digest reported in November 2019 that Perry also owns a log cabin in Jackson Hole, Wyoming, and a \"previously uninhabited island in the Bahamas\" although it's unclear how much they are each worth. Perry told Ellen DeGeneres that he once saw a grizzly bear in the backyard of his Jackson Hole cabin.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f526b517ed0ee001e25d8f6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Jackson Hole Wyoming\" height=\"1611\" width=\"2153\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">WitGorski/Shutterstock.com</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.architecturaldigest.com/story/step-onto-tyler-perrys-300-acre-production-studio\">Architectural Digest</a>, <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jNRNTY-IB50\">The Ellen Show</a></em></p><p>&#160;</p>\n\tReal estate isn't his only major investment. Perry owns a $150 million private jet that he used to fly water and other necessities to the Bahamas in the aftermath of Hurricane Dorian in September 2019.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f526b6fe6ff30001d4e7264?format=jpeg\" alt=\"FILE PHOTO: A man walks among the debris of his house after Hurricane Dorian hit the Abaco Islands in Spring City, Bahamas, September 11, 2019. REUTERS/Marco Bello - RC1D219815D0/File Photo\" height=\"4480\" width=\"5973\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>FILE PHOTO: A man walks among the debris of his house after Hurricane Dorian hit the Abaco Islands in Spring City\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/09/06/us/tyler-perry-bahamas-trnd/index.html\">CNN</a></em></p>\n\tPerry is also known to be generous with his wealth. In July 2020, he gifted approximately $50,000 in grocery store gift cards to those to needed help. He's also run The Perry Foundation since 2006. The foundation works on helping those at an economic disadvantage and has a focus on areas like education, human rights, and health.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f526cbc7ed0ee001e25d909?format=jpeg\" alt=\"coronavirus\" height=\"1260\" width=\"1680\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Healthcare workers dressed in full protective gear organize their documents of data they have collected during a house-to-house new coronavirus testing drive, ringed by a produce market in the Villa Dolores neighborhood of El Alto, Bolivia, Saturday, July 18, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"http://www.apimages.com/metadata/Index/APTOPIX-Virus-Outbreak-Bolivia/9a084de3837145efa5da15d1cf1244d4/1/0\" target=\"_blank\">Juan Karita/AP</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.today.com/news/tyler-perry-gives-out-grocery-store-gift-cards-atlanta-communities-t187139\">Today</a>, <a href=\"https://perry-foundation.org/\">The Perry Foundation</a></em></p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a cf1e6ff30001d4e727b?format=jpeg":null,"https://i.insider.com/5f526d287ed0ee001e25d90d?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn4@2020_2/2020/09/05/09-01-21-380_897ea6dc3b6fc808.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f526c4be6ff30001d4e7275?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn20@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-24-823_b411296fc0393e2b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f526c067ed0ee001e25d8fd?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn6@2020_2/2020/09/05/09-01-17-069_767dfb460a7e936e.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f354e1be89ebf001f04448c?format=jpeg":null,"https://i.insider.com/5f526c9ee6ff30001d4e7276?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn26@2020_2/2020/09/05/09-01-19-401_2f4534ec8f3269e1.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ef1262f19182445cf04be93?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn12@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-14-796_6a13f6bc30adf870.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f3d8f6842f43f001ddfde98?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn82@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-14-237_05b1a627b2ea9146.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f526b3be6ff30001d4e7262?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn9@2020_6/2020/09/05/09-01-19-167_ffba535a456143b7.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f526b517ed0ee001e25d8f6?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn59@2020_5/2020/09/05/09-01-15-137_34d4c53fd184e36e.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f526b6fe6ff30001d4e7264?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn37@2020_6/2020/09/05/09-01-21-852_d8f628863c64ead3.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f526cbc7ed0ee001e25d909?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn80@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-22-016_c6e7eef1596ef026.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn60@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-18-751_00f09200df8426be.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=aoJaPl2uF4A:fwy9kYV1DuA:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn84@2020_5/2020/09/05/09-01-18-899_fa706ecab4d29fd4.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=aoJaPl2uF4A:fwy9kYV1DuA:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn39@2020_6/2020/09/05/09-01-22-532_3d9a77fd23d8759c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=aoJaPl2uF4A:fwy9kYV1DuA:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn89@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-16-155_7d60837dbec135ad.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn54@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-18-350_767e235117808cfa.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn12@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-17-769_edf0fa9b5dde1c97.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/clusterstock/~4/aoJaPl2uF4A":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn85@2020_6/2020/09/05/09-01-20-518_03dcda9fcd181ba7.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599296467322},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","title":"Democrat Christina Finello moves to unseat Republican Rep. Brian Fitzpatrick in Pennsylvania's 1st Congressional District","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/pennsylvania-1st-district-house-election-brian-fitzpatrick-christina-finello-2020","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f3547cfe89ebf001f044457?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Rep. Brian Fitzpatrick\" height=\"1500\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Rep. Brian Fitzpatrick, R-Pa., poses for photographs during a campaign event at the Load Rite Trailers manufacturing facility in Hills, Pa., Monday, Sept. 17, 2018.\n<p class=\"copyright\">(AP Photo/Matt Rourke)</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Rep. Brian Fitzpatrick looks to retain his seat against Christina Finello, a Democrat with DCCC backing.</li>\n<li>Fitzpatrick is one of three Republican House incumbents up for re-election in a district won by Hillary Clinton in 2016.</li>\n<li>Pennsylvania redrew its congressional map in 2018 after being deemed unconstitutional by the Pennsylvania Supreme Court.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>&#160;</p><p><strong>Republican Rep. Brian Fitzpatrick </strong>and <strong>Christina</strong> <strong>Finello&#160;</strong>face off in Pennsylvania's 1st Congressional District in the second election since the redrawing of Pennsylvania's congressional map in 2018.</p><p>Fitzpatrick has outraised Finello fivefold, but Democrats hope to expand their hold on the House of Representatives after flipping 40 seats during the 2018 midterm elections, and hope that changes to Pennsylvania's district map offer a number of opportunities to do so.&#160;</p><h2>The candidates&#160;</h2><p>In 2016, Fitzpatrick was elected as the representative for Pennsylvania's 8th Congressional District. In 2018, following court-ordered redistricting, Fitzpatrick's district number changed and he was elected to the state's 1st Congressional District. Fitzpatrick, along with Rep. John Katko of New York and Rep. Mike Garcia of California, is also <a href=\"https://ballotpedia.org/Pennsylvania%27s_1st_Congressional_District_election,_2020#District_represented_by_a_Republican_in_2020_and_won_by_Hillary_Clinton_in_2016\">one of three House Republican</a> incumbents up for re-election in a district which was won by Hillary Clinton in 2016.</p><p>A former FBI agent, Fitzpatrick has <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/here-are-the-republicans-who-voted-condemn-trumps-tweets-2019-7\">spoken out against President Donald Trump</a> and historically has not always voted by party line. Fitzpatrick originally won the seat in 2016 after his <a href=\"https://www.inquirer.com/philly/blogs/capitolinq/Is-Rep-Fitzpatricks-brother-running-to-replace-him.html\">older brother, Mike Fitzpatrick</a>, stepped down after promising to limit himself to four terms in office.</p><p>Finello, Fitzpatrick's Democratic opponent, has served as the Deputy Director of the Bucks County Department of Housing and Human Services for over 5 years. In early July, Finello received a <a href=\"https://redtoblue.dccc.org/\">\"Red to Blue\"</a> status from the Democratic National Campaign Committee, which provided her with organizational and fundraising support for the rest of her campaign.</p><p>Finello's campaign platform revolves around healthcare reform and expanding access to affordable healthcare, citing her own experience having major <a href=\"https://www.finelloforcongress.com/\">difficulties obtaining healthcare</a> while pregnant and after, while parenting and raising her family.&#160;</p><h2>The district</h2><p>Pennsylvania's congressional map was redrawn in 2018 by the Supreme Court of Pennsylvania after its congressional <a href=\"https://www.inquirer.com/philly/news/politics/pennsylvania-gerrymandering-supreme-court-map-congressional-districts-2018-elections-20180219.html\">map was deemed unconstitutionally gerrymandered.</a></p><p>The state's newly drawn 1st Congressional District now contains all of Bucks County, home of Strayer University and La Salle University, instead of splitting the county into two districts. The district also contains a small sliver of Montgomery County.</p><p>Clinton would have carried the district under its current boundaries by two points, 49% to 47%, over President Donald Trump, <a href=\"https://www.dailykos.com/stories/2012/11/19/1163009/-Daily-Kos-Elections-presidential-results-by-congressional-district-for-the-2012-2008-elections\">according to the Daily Kos.</a></p><h2>The money race</h2><p>According to the <a href=\"https://www.opensecrets.org/races/summary?cycle=2020&id=PA01PA01\">Center for Responsive Politics</a>, Fitzpatrick has raised $2.7 million, five times more than Finello who has raised $500,000. According to Finello's campaign, she brought in $300,000 of her campaign total in the second quarter of 2020 and raised <a href=\"https://levittownnow.com/2020/07/08/candidate-finellos-fundraising-rises-but-congressman-holds-advantage/\">$210,000 in June alone</a>.</p><h2>What experts say</h2><p>The race between Fitzpatrick and Finello is rated as \"leans Republican\" by <a href=\"http://centerforpolitics.org/crystalball/2020-house/\">Sabato's Crystal Ball at the University of Virginia Center for Politics</a>, the <a href=\"https://cookpolitical.com/ratings/house-race-ratings\">Cook Political Report</a>, and \"tilts Republican\" by <a href=\"https://insideelections.com/ratings/house\">Inside Elections.</a></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/pennsylvania-1st-district-house-election-brian-fitzpatrick-christina-finello-2020'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?a=xrRz5CYfweg:KDMAekNM8PA:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?a=xrRz5CYfweg:KDMAekNM8PA:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=xrRz5CYfweg:KDMAekNM8PA:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?a=xrRz5CYfweg:KDMAekNM8PA:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/clusterstock/~4/xrRz5CYfweg\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 20:40:51 +0000","feedId":13983,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f3547cfe89ebf001f044457?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"8544c8aa96a4fed56995aeec786cdc58","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn26@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-07-481_2b163f1011060f2d.webp","destWidth":3000,"destHeight":1500,"sourceBytes":133772,"destBytes":133772,"author":"mhall@businessinsider.com (Madison Hall)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f3547cfe89ebf001f044457?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn26@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-07-481_2b163f1011060f2d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn60@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-18-751_00f09200df8426be.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=xrRz5CYfweg:KDMAekNM8PA:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn84@2020_2/2020/09/05/09-01-17-657_f1f2b16d00a662d2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=xrRz5CYfweg:KDMAekNM8PA:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn34@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-21-728_57afcb298fc4470b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=xrRz5CYfweg:KDMAekNM8PA:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn93@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-15-522_9cc513fdb021911a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn54@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-18-350_767e235117808cfa.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn12@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-17-769_edf0fa9b5dde1c97.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/clusterstock/~4/xrRz5CYfweg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn92@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-24-478_5337f4731ba11411.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599296467310},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","title":"First-term Rep. Antonio Delgado looks to defend his seat against Kyle Van De Water in New York's 19th Congressional District","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/new-york-19th-district-house-election-antonio-delgado-kyle-van-de-water-2020","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f3d6d7642f43f001ddfdda6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Antonio Delgado\" height=\"1389\" width=\"2777\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Rep. Antonio Delgado talks with a teen boy while campaigning, Saturday, Oct. 13, 2013 in Schodack Landing, N.Y. Delgado defeated Republican U.S. Rep. John Faso for the District 19 seat.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Mary Esch/AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>First-term Rep. Antonio Delgado will face Kyle Van De Water in New York's 19th Congressional District.</li>\n<li>New York's 19th Congressional District is located in the Catskill Mountains and mid-Hudson Valley regions.</li>\n<li>The district is one of thirty in the United States which voted for President Donald Trump in 2016 but is currently represented by a Democrat.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>&#160;</p><p>First-term <strong>Rep. Antonio Delgado</strong> looks to defend his seat against Republican <strong>Kyle Van De Water</strong> in New York's 19th Congressional District.</p><h2>The candidates</h2><p>Delgado, the incumbent, is a former musician and lawyer. He currently sits on the House committees on Agriculture, Small Business, and Transportation and Infrastructure.&#160; Delgado is a member of the Congressional Black Caucus, the Congressional LGBT Equality Caucus, as well as the Women's Veterans Task Force. His <a href=\"https://delgadoforcongress.com/issues-list/\">campaign is centered around</a> providing assistance to the country's farmers, aiding the LGBT community, immigration reform, and women's rights.</p><p>Van De Water is a veteran of the U.S. Army and currently is a member of the U.S. Army Reserves JAG Corps. He is a practicing litigation attorney in Poughkeepsie. Van De Water's <a href=\"https://www.kyleforny19.com/issues\">campaign platform</a> is directly in line with that of President Donald Trump, including promises to strengthen the U.S. border, supporting tax cuts, and protecting 2nd Amendment rights.</p><h2>The district</h2><p>New York's 19th Congressional District is located in the Catskill Mountains and Hudson Valley areas. The district is home to all of Ulster, Schoharie, Otsego, Delaware, Columbia, Green, and Sullivan counties as well as portions of Dutchess, Montgomery, Rensselaer, and Broome counties.</p><p>The district is one of thirty across the country which voted for President Donald Trump in 2016 but is currently represented by a Democrat, flipping to vote for former President Barack Obama in 2012 to Trump in 2016, <a href=\"https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1whYBonfwlgTGnYl7U_IH31G0JNYQ9QBIjDfqkZHkW-0/edit#gid=0\">according to the Daily Kos.&#160;</a></p><p>President Trump received 50.8 percent of the district's vote in 2016, 6.8 percentage points more than the Democratic nominee, Hillary Clinton's 44%, <a href=\"https://www.dailykos.com/stories/2012/11/19/1163009/-Daily-Kos-Elections-presidential-results-by-congressional-district-for-the-2012-2008-elections\">according to the Daily Kos.</a></p><h2>The money race</h2><p>According <a href=\"https://www.opensecrets.org/races/summary?cycle=2020&id=NY19NY19\">to the Center for Responsive Politics</a>, Delgado has raised $4.2 million – 200 times more than Van De Water with $21,000 raised so far this cycle. Van De Water currently has only $4,137 in cash on hand compared to Delgado's $3 million.</p><h2>What experts say</h2><p>The race between Delgado and Van De Water is rated as \"leans Democratic\" by <a href=\"https://cookpolitical.com/ratings/house-race-ratings\">The Cook Political Report</a>, \"likely Democratic\" by <a href=\"http://centerforpolitics.org/crystalball/2020-house/\">Sabato's Crystal Ball at the University of Virginia Center for Politics</a>, and \"safe Democratic\" according to <a href=\"https://insideelections.com/ratings/house\">Inside Elections</a>.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/new-york-19th-district-house-election-antonio-delgado-kyle-van-de-water-2020'>Business
