(Abigail Abesamis)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f43d75089aff80028ab7776?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn72@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-23-574_65eb5126e5bec922.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f43d16989aff80028ab7754?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn37@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-23-410_4a87e0729131cfff.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f43d22542f43f001ddfe984?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn45@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-20-951_6e6e224cbf7546d8.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f43ce3789aff80028ab7741?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn46@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-20-198_b3eb37b98a60888a.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f43d07d89aff80028ab774f?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn7@2020_6/2020/09/05/09-01-22-229_95a5462290b6194b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f43cf2e89aff80028ab774a?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn51@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-15-112_3bcb53562acfd6a5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn60@2020_3/2020/09/05/09-01-18-751_00f09200df8426be.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=4EQKOiEHWSg:OlBp4iAvgLM:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn88@2020_2/2020/09/05/09-01-22-962_b4d00ccebd893c46.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=4EQKOiEHWSg:OlBp4iAvgLM:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn92@2020_2/2020/09/05/09-01-18-404_c9331a6ce411e5a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?i=4EQKOiEHWSg:OlBp4iAvgLM:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn41@2020_6/2020/09/05/09-01-23-461_3c2767b09cc0910d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn54@2020_1/2020/09/05/09-01-18-350_767e235117808cfa.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/clusterstock?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn12@2020_4/2020/09/05/09-01-17-769_edf0fa9b5dde1c97.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/clusterstock/~4/4EQKOiEHWSg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn1@2020_6/2020/09/05/09-01-15-305_c259e480d1627fcb.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599296467306},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","title":"How to post videos on IGTV, Instagram's dedicated section for longer videos","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-post-on-igtv","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ebc28ab48d92c73a3205553?format=jpeg\" alt=\"woman using iphone pink\" height=\"1139\" width=\"2279\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>It&#39;s easy to post IGTV videos.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Roman Samborskyi/Shutterstock</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>You can post on IGTV from the Instagram mobile app by selecting the \"Long Video\" option when you upload a video, or on a desktop through your profile page.</li>\n<li>Normal Instagram videos can only be up to a minute long, but IGTV videos can be up to an hour.</li>\n<li>The first 15 seconds of your IGTV video will be posted on your feed, and followers can tap or click it to watch the full video.</li>\n<li>This story is part of&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-instagram-how-to-use-guide\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\" data-uri=\"7fd6f1a47653c3fd1e5a3c6d555c08ce\">Business Insider's Guide to Instagram</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Normally, when you post a video on Instagram, it can only be a minute long. This isn't great if you've made a longer piece, like a short film.</p><p>That's where <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/igtv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">IGTV</a> comes in. IGTV is a section of Instagram that lets users upload and watch longer videos.</p><p>You can upload IGTV videos up to 15 minutes long via the Instagram mobile app, and up to an hour long using the website. And these videos count as posts, so they won't disappear after a day like Stories.</p><p>Before you post, however, you'll need to make sure your video meets <a href=\"https://help.instagram.com/381435875695118\">the requirements outlined in Instagram's Help Center</a>.&#160;</p><p>In short, your video needs to be at least a minute long. And if you're posting from a computer, the video has to be an .MP4 file, and under a certain size — less than 650 MB if the video is shorter than 10 minutes, and less than 3.6 GB if it's between 10 and 60 minutes.</p><p>Here's everything you need to know about posting to IGTV from your phone or computer.</p><h2><strong>How to post a video on IGTV using the Instagram mobile app</strong></h2><p><strong>1. </strong>Open the Instagram app and tap the plus icon at the bottom of the screen.</p><p><strong>2. </strong>Select the video you want to upload, then tap \"Next.\"</p><p><strong>3. </strong>In the \"Share as…\" menu that pops up, select \"Long Video\" to share the full-length video on IGTV. Tap \"Continue.\"</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f527e3f7ed0ee001e25d9a5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_4001.PNG\" height=\"2208\" width=\"1242\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>You&#39;ll want to post this as a full &#34;Long Video,&#34; rather than a regular shortened video.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Abigail Abesamis/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>4. </strong>Tap or slide the rectangle along the video preview to select a cover image for your IGTV post.&#160;Alternatively, you can select a photo from your Camera Roll as the cover image by tapping the plus icon at the bottom of the screen.</p><p>When you've selected your cover photo, tap \"Next.\"</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f527f3ee6ff30001d4e7321?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_4002.PNG\" height=\"2208\" width=\"1242\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>You have two options for picking a cover.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Abigail Abesamis/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>5. </strong>Add a title and description to your video by tapping on the respective fields.</p><p><strong>6. </strong>To add your video to an IGTV series, tap \"Add to Series.\" If you're creating a series for the first time, you'll be prompted to \"Create Your First Series\" with a series name and optional description. This is great if you're going to be posting multiple similar videos.&#160;</p><p><strong>7. </strong>To post a preview of your IGTV video on your feed and profile, make sure the \"Post a Preview\" slider is in the \"on\" position (colored blue). Previews will show the first 15 seconds of your video. If you're posting a preview, tap \"Edit Profile Cover\" to adjust how the IGTV cover photo appears on your grid. Tap \"Save\" to save your changes.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5280237ed0ee001e25d9b3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_4004.PNG\" height=\"2208\" width=\"1242\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>There are a variety of options when it comes to customizing your IGTV video.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Abigail Abesamis/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>8. </strong>Tap \"Post\" to post your IGTV video.</p><h2><strong>How to post a video on IGTV using the website</strong></h2><p><strong>1. </strong>Go to your profile on <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/?hl=en\">Instagram's desktop website</a>.</p><p><strong>2. </strong>Click \"IGTV\" in the menu bar just above your photo grid.</p><p><strong>3. </strong>Click \"Upload.\"</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5282c7e6ff30001d4e7332?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2020 09 03 at 11.39.30 AM\" height=\"1618\" width=\"2880\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>You can upload IGTV videos from your profile page.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Abigail Abesamis/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>4. </strong>Click the \"+\" icon to choose a video or drag and drop a video file into the box.</p><p><strong>5. </strong>Add a title and description to your video by typing in the respective fields.</p><p><strong>6. </strong>To post a preview of your IGTV video on your feed and profile, make sure the \"Post a Preview\" box is checked.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5282ffe6ff30001d4e7333?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2020 09 03 at 11.47.30 AM\" height=\"1641\" width=\"2880\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Fill out the details and post.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Abigail Abesamis/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>7. </strong>Click \"Post.\"&#160;</p><h2><strong>Related coverage from&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"4c86c1c3a45644bf07d168dc4c802e5e\">Tech Reference</a>:</strong></h2><ul><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-clear-instagram-cache-on-iphone\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"bc5a7b0627c4b6d2233f28b344ba8043\">How to clear the Instagram cache on your iPhone to free up storage space<br></a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-add-highlights-on-instagram\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"065b866d432b3565012d8425573029f4\">How to add Story Highlights on your Instagram profile in 7 simple steps</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-disable-comments-on-instagram\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"cc961c825f32a143c680a596590e1de8\">How to disable comments on Instagram on a post-by-post basis</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-add-location-on-instagram-story\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"62430e08f0e70e2450876843b97a2c19\">How d3a29f00.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599296467307},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","title":"The biggest police union in the US just endorsed Trump for president","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/biggest-police-union-fop-endorses-trump-for-president-over-biden-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ee2a3375af6cc403377da53?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NYPD Police officers listen as Police Benevolent Association of the City of New York President Pat Lynch and representatives from other NYPD and law enforcement unions holds a news conference at the Icahn Stadium parking lot on June 9, 2020 to address the &#34;current anti-law enforcement environment.&#34; in New York.\" and law enforcement unions holds a news conference at the Icahn Stadium parking lot on June 9, 2020 to address the &#34;current anti-law enforcement environment.&#34; in New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">TIMOTHY A. CLARY/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The largest police union in the US endorsed President Trump for President on Friday.</li>\n<li>The move aligns with Trump's messaging that he is the \"president of law and order.\"&#160;</li>\n<li>Biden, who recently questioned how safe people feel under Trump's current presidency, leads the president in the polls by seven points, according to FiveThirtyEight data.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>The largest police union in the US, which represents more than 355,000 police officers, endorsed Donald Trump for president on Friday.</p><p>\"Look at what the national discourse has focused on for the last six months. President Trump has shown time after time that he supports our law enforcement officers and understands the issues our members face every day,\" said Patrick Yoes, President of the Fraternal Order of Police in a <a href=\"https://fop.net/CmsDocument/Doc/pr_2020-0904_FOP-endorses-Trump.pdf\">press release</a>. \"The FOP is proud to endorse a candidate who calls for law and order across our nation.\"</p><p>The statement aligns with President Trump's attempts to brand himself as \"your president of law and order,\" a claim his rival Joe Biden has <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/31/us/politics/biden-speech-trump.html\">questioned</a>. Trump reacted to nationwide protests against police brutality by condemning looting and sending National Guard troops and federal law enforcement to Washington, D.C. and Portland Oregon, while falsely accusing Biden of trying to defund the police.&#160;</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Donald J. Trump  (@realDonaldTrump) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1275871808261107712?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">June 24, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>&#160;</p><p>The FOP isn't the only police union to come out in support in Trump. During last week's Republican National Convention, Pat Lynch of the Patrolmen Benevolent Association, the largest police union in New York City, endorsed Trump as well, <a href=\"https://gothamist.com/news/black-nypd-officers-say-unions-trump-endorsement-takes-police-dark-place\">Gothamist reported</a>.&#160;</p><p>President Trump's <a href=\"https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/trump-approval-ratings/\">disapproval rating clocks in at 52.2%</a>&#160;and he trails Joe Biden by seven points in <a href=\"https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/national/\">polls for the general election</a>, according to data from FiveThirtyEight.</p><p>The FOP also endorsed Trump in the 2016 election. Over the years, the union also backed George H.W. Bush, Bill Clinton, George W. Bush, and John McCain.&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a Galaxy.\"</li><li>All three classic games have been upgraded to high definition resolution and given updated controls, though the general look and feel will remain the same.</li><li>However, Nintendo says \"Super Mario 3D All-Stars\" will only be available for purchase until March 31, 2021.</li><li>Read more: <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-nintendo-switch-games\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best Nintendo Switch games</a></li></ul><p>Nintendo will release three classic \"Super Mario\" games for the Nintendo Switch in a collection called <a href=\"https://bestbuy.7tiv.net/c/196318/614286/10014?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fsite%2Fsuper-mario-3d-all-stars-nintendo-switch-nintendo-switch-lite%2F6414104.p%3FskuId%3D6414104\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">\"Super Mario 3D All-Stars\"</a> on September 18. The games included are \"Super Mario 64,\" \"Super Mario Sunshine,\" and \"Super Mario Galaxy.\"&#160;</p><iframe width=\"560\" height=\"315\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/CPJcaGWoO2c\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe><p><a href=\"https://bestbuy.7tiv.net/c/196318/614286/10014?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fsite%2Fsuper-mario-3d-all-stars-nintendo-switch-nintendo-switch-lite%2F6414104.p%3FskuId%3D6414104\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">\"Super Mario 3D All-Stars\"</a> will cost $60 for all three games and both physical and digital versions will be available. However, Nintendo says \"Super Mario 3D All-Stars\" will only be available until March 31, 2021, at which point the digital download will no longer be available and new physical copies will no longer be made.</p><p>It's unclear why \"Super Mario 3D All-Stars\" will only be made available for a limited time, especially since \"Super Mario\" is Nintendo's flagship franchise and fans have been eager to see the games restored and preserved on Nintendo's newest hardware.</p><p>Digital versions of \"Super Mario 64,\" \"Super Mario Galaxy,\" and \"Super Mario Galaxy 2\" are available on Nintendo's previous console, the Wii U. \"Super Mario Sunshine\" was released for the Nintendo GameCube in 2002 and you still need the original game disc to play it legally — the game has never been made available digitally before \"Super Mario 3D All-Stars.\"</p><p>Hopefully, Nintendo will make \"Super Mario 64,\" \"Super Mario Sunshine,\" and \"Super Mario Galaxy\" available as separate digital downloads when \"Super Mario 3D All-Stars\" is no longer available, and with any luck, \"Super Mario Galaxy 2\" will be added to the Switch library as well.</p><h2>How to preorder \"Super Mario 3D All-Stars\" for the Nintendo Switch</h2><p>You can preorder \"Super Mario 3D All-Stars\" digitally through <a href=\"https://www.nintendo.com/games/detail/super-mario-3d-all-stars-switch/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Nintendo's eShop</a>, which will let you download the game in advance to play as soon as it's released on September 18. As noted above, the game will only be available to buy until March 31, 2021.</p><p>If you want a physical copy to keep long after Nintendo stops selling \"Super Mario 3D All-Stars,\" you can preorder The company made slew of announcements that included several new games.&#160;</p><p>Another updated release for the Switch, \"<a href=\"https://bestbuy.7tiv.net/c/196318/614286/10014?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fsite%2Fsuper-mario-3d-world-bowsers-fury-nintendo-switch-nintendo-switch-lite%2F6414113.p%3FskuId%3D6414113\" 17:01:07","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 17:01:07","title":"Rep. Steve Chabot squares off against Democrat Kate Schroder in Ohio's 1st Congressional District","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/ohio-1st-district-house-election-steve-chabot-kate-schroder-2020","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f3d8daf42f43f001ddfde90?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Steve Chabot\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Steve Chabot, R-Ohio, speaks after winning the election in Ohio&#39;s 1st congressional district race against incumbent Democratic U.S. Rep. Steve Driehaus, Tuesday, Nov. 2, 2010, in Cincinnati.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"http://www.apimages.com/metadata/Index/Ohio-Congress/c752808b298343e1a932e072bac6a9da/13/0\" target=\"_blank\">Al Behrman/AP</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Rep. Steve Chabot will face Kate Schroder in Ohio's 1st Congressional District.</li>\n<li>The district is located in the southwestern area of Ohio and contains the western region of Cincinnati, Ohio's third-largest city.</li>\n<li>Chabot has served ten non-consecutive terms as the Representative for Ohio's 1st Congressional District.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>&#160;</p><p>Incumbent <strong>Rep. Steve Chabot</strong> will face off against Democrat <strong>Kate Schroder</strong> in a hotly-contested race for Ohio's 1st Congressional District.</p><h2>The candidates</h2><p>Chabot was originally elected into the House in 1994, where he then represented Ohio's 1st Congressional district for 7 terms before being ousted in the 2008 election by Democrat Steve Driehaus. Chabot defeated Driehaus in 2010 and regained his seat, holding it for another 5 terms. Chabot's <a href=\"https://stevechabot.com/issues/\">campaign is centered upon</a> fiscally responsible government spending, protecting the country against cybersecurity threats, and revitalizing the U.S. economy.</p><p>Chabot previously served on the committees on Foreign Affairs and Judiciary. He is currently the Ranking Member of the <a href=\"https://smallbusiness.house.gov/about/membership.htm\">House Committee on Small Business</a>.</p><p>Schroder, a former healthcare researcher and consultant, was the vice president of the Clinton Health Access Initiative. In 2016, she was appointed to the Cincinnati Board of Health where she currently sits as a finance chair. A Hodgkin's Lymphoma cancer survivor, her <a href=\"https://kateforcongress.com/issues/\">campaign is focused on</a> improving access to affordable healthcare, reducing gun violence, adding new jobs, and improving federal and state infrastructure.&#160;</p><p>Two recent Democratic internal polls <a href=\"https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/house/ohio/\">point to a competitive race</a> between Chabot and Schroder. An internal poll conducted for the Schroder campaign from June 29 to July 2 <a href=\"https://thehill.com/homenews/campaign/508362-internal-poll-shows-tight-race-brewing-in-key-ohio-house-race\">found Chabot ahead by two points</a>, 48% to 46.</p><p>Another internal poll conducted for the Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee from July 13-15 found Schroeder <a href=\"https://twitter.com/kirk_bado/status/1290637888716251136\">ahead by one point</a>, 47% to 46%, and Democratic nominee Biden leading President Donald Trump by three points, 48% to 45%.&#160;</p><h2>The district</h2><p>Ohio's 1st Congressional District is located in the southwestern region of the state and contains the western area of Cincinnati, the state's third-largest city. The district also includes Warren County and portions of Hamilton County as well.&#160;</p><p>This district voted for 2012 Republican nominee Mitt Romney by six percentage points and voted for Trump by 6.6 points in 2016, <a href=\"https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1whYBonfwlgTGnYl7U_IH31G0JNYQ9QBIjDfqkZHkW-0/edit#gid=0\">according to the Daily Kos.</a></p><h2>The money race</h2><p>According to the <a href=\"https://www.opensecrets.org/races/summary?cycle=2020&id=OH01&spec=Np;spec=N\">Center for Responsive Politics</a>, Chabot has raised $1.97 million, about $500,000 more than Schroder's $1.4 million. Schroder has $500,000 in cash on hand remaining compared to Chabot's $990,000.&#160;</p><h2>What some of the experts say</h2><p>The race between Chabot and Schroder is now rated as a \"toss-up\" by <a href=\"https://cookpolitical.com/ratings/house-race-ratings\">The Cook Political Report,</a>&#160;<a href=\"https://insideelections.com/ratings/house\">Inside Elections</a>, and <a href=\"http://centerforpolitics.org/crystalball/2020-house/\">Sabato's Crystal Ball at the University of Virginia Center for Politics</a>.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on
